loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Betty dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 10,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Inn Du Village Group 1

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Inn Du Village Group 1 named Nyunt, Thein, Sein, Nyunt O and Mya. The previous Kiva loan helped group members purchase high quality feeds and rebuild their duck farms. Due to the success of increased incomes and positive signs of repayment from the previous loan, there is a plan to introduce fourteen new borrowers for the upcoming loan.

This new loan will help Inn Du Village Group 1 to purchase ducklings, piglets and feed, which will boost incomes. The group members are very grateful for the continued generosity and support that they are getting from the Kiva community.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, ducklings and high quality feeds.

loans.name: Chepngetich

texts.en:
This is Chepngetich, a farmer in Kericho. She is the firstborn in a family of six. She farms green leaf tea and dairy and her vision is to be financial stable and create jobs. She is a hard worker and through the agricultural activity she is able to support her siblings and parents.

She wants to buy one cow with the Kiva loan to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for one cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth Wambui

texts.en: Elizabeth is employed and also a farmer with many dairy cows. Each day, she uses so much firewood, which takes up a lot of time for her to collect and light, to warm the milking water.  She learned about Takamoto biogas from a friend and learned of their loans and had an interest in it. With this loan she will be able to save on her cost for fuel and also enjoy clean and reliable cooking energy.

loans.use: To buy a biodigester for clean reliable cooking.

loans.name: Mistubishi Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his early 30's, is married with one small child. He has been running a duka for three years now. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Charles’ fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock, and opened a duka. He is doing great, and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to take care of his family and to repay loans, and he bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy fast moving items like oranges, mangoes, melons and bananas, and to increase shop inventory by buying things like sugar, beans, flours, rice, sweets, biscuits, powdered soap, bar soap, etc. He dreams of building his own house.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group, Mistubish, which consists of two members, who will hold each other accountable to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in his duka (shop), and to increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Aileen has been in this business for 5 years now.

Aileen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Asenal Group

texts.en:
Bahati, who is in her mid 30's is single with two children. She has been selling clothes for 2 years now. She works from 9 am to 6 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock stylish clothes ready for the Christmas sales. She dreams of expanding her business into a whole selling clothing store.

Bahati will share this loan with her loan group ASENAL which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock stylish clothes for the Christmas festival

loans.name: Sarlince

texts.en:
Sarlince is a 42-year-old woman who married to her husband Enos (55) and has 5 children. Sarlince and her husband work hard to pay for their 4 children's educational expenses. It has been years since Sarlince started running her business of selling spices such as turmeric, galangal, lemongrass, cinnamon, cloves, and so forth. From this business Sarlince was able to generate extra income to support her husband.

Last month, Sarlince was introduced to TLM's loan product called SeSaMa. From that Sarlince got interested in a loan to improve her business and requested a loan of amounting IDR 1,750,000 to buy more stock such as coriander, nutmeg, sesame, turmeric, etc. She really hopes that her business can be well developed and will bring good profit for her.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetable in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been in this business for 25 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 50 years old and married with three children.  With one child in school, Anastacia works very hard to provide for them.

Anastacia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to increase inventory for her general store.

Anastacia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, noodles, soft-drinks, biscuits. 

In the future Anastacia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Alicia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alicia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ana industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs. Ana dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gerael Gay

texts.en:
Gerael Gay is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like sugar, school supplies, personal care products, and other groceries to sell.

Gerael Gay successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Gerael Gay dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is married without children.  He is a teacher and has been teaching for the past 5 years.  He is also a student.  He enrolled in 2015 and plans to graduate in the year 2017. He is requesting a school fees loan in order for him to be able to pay the whole sum of tuition at once, since he can only afford to pay it in installments.

loans.use: pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 54 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of three people. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to people, working from her house.

Shumalia needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her business, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shumaila is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

Shumaila much thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby, a 28-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan, looks after her family at home. Her husband provides shutter services for building construction.

Ruby is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner on behalf of her husband so he can buy raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing accessories. These purchases will improve his shuttering work so that he can generate more income to better support his family.

Ruby is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for her husband's shuttering services.

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en:
Nazma is a 51-year-old married mother of four children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver and worked for some contractors in the past. He has 3 years experience in it. Her son is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw.

Now a day Nazma’s son wants to repair his auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to repair his auto rickshaw. Therefore Nazma has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Nazma's son can repair his auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Nazma and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to repair her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Habila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Habila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en: Yim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is a 50-year-old widowed construction worker with four children, who resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. He has worked as a construction worker since 2008. Three of his children are factory workers and the other child attends school. Pheap and his three children can make around $34 per day.

He has decided to take out a loan because he needs money to buy more cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, he will be able to improve the family’s finances. His future plans are to save money to renovate his house and to support his child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Suubi Development Group Bweya

texts.en:
Erina is a repeat client of Ugafode microfinance. She previously took a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman, who owns a market stall selling fruits and vegetables. In a bid to increase her working capital, expand the business and buy more stock of fruits and vegetables, she has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000. She is faced with the challenges of competition and lack of enough capital.


Erina and the other group members are very grateful for the support that Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered, as they are now able to fund their businesses.

The UGAFODE Credit staff is standing at the front extreme left. The lady at the extreme right has a loan with different terms, though she belongs to the group, and signed a waiver form.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Don Fernando como muchos lo conocen, es originario de El Mamey, municipio de Nayarit. Desde hace más de 54 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo, en su juventud acudía a las montañas cercanas a cortar café, fue ahí donde conoció a Brigida, quien ahora es su esposa  y con quien tiene viviendo mas de 40 años.
Diez años después de conocerse lograron que adquirieron un pequeño terreno, el cual le obsequiaron sus familiares. Hace 29 años que decidieron construir su casa de rajas de palma y palapa, desde entonces se han tenido que adaptar a las condiciones que esta casa les brinda, al principio vivieron muy bien pero con el paso de los años empezaron a tener muchos problemas debido a la polilla, además de que  en tiempo de lluvia suele mojarse todo el interior de la casa.
Don Fernando y doña Brígida tuvieron tres hijas pero las tres se casaron y se fueron a vivir a lugares diferentes, por cosas del destino una de ellas tuvo un problema con su esposo y se tuvo que separar de él estando embarazada, en tal situación fue que la acogieron en su casa y fue ahí en esa casa de palma en donde nació su nieto José Armando. Posteriormente su hija se fue a trabajar fuera para regresar junto con el papá de su niño tres años después. Ambos  padres al ver el cariño y la forma en como trataban a José Armando decidieron dejarlo  con sus abuelos para siempre. Hoy José Armando sigue viviendo con sus abuelos a quienes quiere como padres y casi a diario va a visitar a sus papás pues ellos viven en la misma comunidad. José Armando  quiere ser doctor de grande  y sus abuelos manifiestan que así será ya que ellos desean  ofrecerle todo por lograr sus sueño.
Desde que ellos viven en la comunidad se consideran bendecidos pues gozan de mucha tranquilidad y abundante agua, nunca han tenido problemas a excepción de las terribles condiciones  en las que viven en su actual casita de palma. 
En su tiempo libre se van a pasear a caminar al campo y a disfrutar de una comida que calientan en una fogata a campo abierto.
Ellos reciben ayuda de sus demás hijas y creen que jamás quedaran mal  con sus pagos del préstamo que KIVA les pueda apoyar.
texts.en:
Fernando, as he is known by many, is from El Mamey, in the municipality of Nayarit. For more than 54 years he has worked in the fields. When he was young he would go to the nearby mountains to cut coffee. It was there that he met Brigida, who is now his wife, and with whom he has lived for more than 40 years. Ten years after meeting, they were able to acquire a small plot of land, which was gifted to them by relatives. Twenty nine years ago they decided to build a house of strips and fronds of palm. Since then they have had to adapt to the conditions brought about by this house. At the beginning they lived very well, but with the passage of time they began to have many problems due to moths. In addition, in the rainy season the entire interior of the house gets wet.

Fernando and Brigida had three girls, but all three married and went to live elsewhere. As fate would have it, one of them had problems with her husband, and had to leave him while she was pregnant. From that situation, Fernando and Brigida welcomed her into their house, and it was there, in the house of palm, that their grandson José Armando was born. Later their daughter left to work elsewhere and reunited with the father of her child three years later. Both parents, seeing the love and the manner in which Fernando and Brigida treated José Armando, decided to leave him with his grandparents for good. Today José Armando continues living with his grandparents who love him like parents. He goes almost every day to see his parents since they live in the same community. José Armando wants to be a doctor when he grows up, and his grandparents confirm that this will be so, as they wish to offer him everything to realize his dream.

Since they have lived in this community, Fernando and Brigida consider themselves blessed as they enjoy much tranquility and abundant water. They have never had problems except for the terrible conditions in which they live in the current house of palm. In their free time they go to walk through the fields and enjoy food that they heat over an open air fire.

They receive help from their other daughters and believe that they will never fall behind on the loan that Kiva can provide them.

loans.use: to give his grand-child Armando a proper home in which to make his dream come true: to become a doctor.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio es un hombre trabajador de 33 años de edad que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos metálicos como: portones, ventanas, puertas, balcones, entre otros productos muy solicitados por sus clientes, por ser de excelente calidad. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre de 56 años de edad, a la que apoya mucho, ya que sabe que él es su único apoyo. Mauricio desea invertir en su taller de estructuras metálicas, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: electrodos, tubos de hierro, aparato de soldadura, entre otros materiales necesarios para su taller de estructuras metálicas.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a 33 year old man who works manufacturing different metallic products such as gates, windows, doors, and balconies, among other products, which are sought by his clients due to their excellent quality. He lives in a house he owns, with his mother who is 56 years old, whom he helps a good deal, since he knows he is her only support.

Mauricio wants to invest in his metal shop. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to to invest in electrodes, iron tubes, and soldering equipment, among other materials necessary for his metal shop.

loans.use: to invest in electrodes, iron tubes, and soldering equipment, among other materials, necessary for his  metal shop.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in the Lahore, Pakistan area.

Rehana practices hand embroidery work at home and is able to financially support her family. She belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is so poor that she decided to start embroidery work at home. She learned this art in her childhood, and now she has adopted it for her occupation. She manages to keep independent and yet still earn a sufficient income.

Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of thread, silk, sequins, and pearls of various colours. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to purchase stocks of thread, silk, sequins, and pearls for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Usaha Kecil Group

texts.en:
The Usaha Kecil Group is made up of five members with their own businesses. Nelci, 37, was appointed as the leader of group. Nelci is married to Lukas, a 37-year-old fishmonger and blessed with two children who are in elementary school.

In order to make more income, Nelci buys vegetables from the farmers to be resold at the night market. With IDR 200,000 she could buy one to two sacks of vegetables. The income earned allows her to help her husband manage their needs and the education costs of their children.
Nelci wishes to provide vegetables in a larger quantity. The price charged by the farmer is a bit high lately but on the other hand, the customers also demand more vegetables to be consumed. Therefore, she needs more money to do so.

When an Account Officer introduced the TLM group loan product to Nelci and the other four women, they were interested in it. They then formed the Usaha Kecil Group and requested a loan totaling IDR 10,000,000. The group will use the loan for improving their own businesses. They are expecting the loan will help them to make their businesses better.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as water spinach

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 38 years old and has three children. She lives with her family in Lahore.

Razia's husband drives a rickshaw. He is hard working and obedient. He wakes up early in the morning and goes out to provide passenger pick-up and drop-off services. He roams around the city all day, providing transportation services to the locals. His wife feels proud of her husband and is sure that he will fulfill his dream of having a rickshaw service soon.

Due to constant wear and tear, Razia's husband's rickshaw gets stuck each day, creating difficulty in driving. Razia wants to help her husband by requesting a loan for him from BRAC Pakistan so that he can drive smoothly without any interruption.

loans.use: to help her husband with the maintenance of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is proud to be a farmer. He cultivates his farm and grows rice. He is a helpful man who always puts God first in anything he does. Paul is 54 years old and blessed with five children. His aspiration to work hard is his children. He wants them to have a comfortable life and better future.

With regards to his farming business, Paul wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm. Paul believes that by having the loan, he will provide all his farm needs. He is hoping to harvest more and get a bigger income as well. He will use his earnings for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 65 years old and married with five children, one in school. Zenaida works very hard to provide for her family.

Zenaida has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 42 years old, and she is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Daisy has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Lirjan

texts.en:
Lirjan is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek to buy a dairy cow and two goats.
Lirjan is a 56-year-old villager and married father of two children.

Agriculture is the activity that he's been practicing for over 20 years. "For all these years I've been doing agriculture. I own 9 dynym of land and I plant wheat in 2 dynym, fodder in the other 2 dynym, rye in 4 dynym and medicinal flowers in 1 dynym. The annual net earnings from the selling of such products is as follows: $142 from wheat, $660 from fodder, $1,500 from the medicinal flowers and $755 from rye. All in all, the earnings are not enough, but better than nothing or better from those families who own no land to plant anything. Now, I thought of adding some dairy animals to my activity," said Lirjan to the loan officer who interviewed him.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and two milk goats

loans.name: Fahrurozi

texts.en:
This is Fahrurozi, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in East Serang, a suburban area located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children. He owns a stall where he sells snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community.

He joined Ruma because he wants to learn about how to improve his business, as well as how to contribute more to his community. He feels happy because the sales executive is being kind and helpful to him.

As the business grows, Fahrurozi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. This loan will help him improve his business and, accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. Fahrurozi is in the photo in front of his stall. He is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Edlira

texts.en:
Edlira is a member of the ethnic Egyptian Albanian community and lives in a village, doing agriculture and raising livestock. She is a married mother of two children, ages 18 and 16. She is requesting this loan to pay for the higher education of the older son who is studying in a public university in the capital city far from home.

Edlira owns 4 dynym land and rents from other villagers about 20 more dynym where she plants wheat in 10 dynym with annual gross earnings about $1,570; She also plants fodder in 9 dynym and corn in 5 dynym, yet she does not sell them because she keeps it to feed the two dairy cows and calves. The annual gross earnings from the raw milk is $4,200 and from the calves $950/year.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition/dorm fees of her older son who is studying far from home.

loans.name: Amos

texts.es:
El socio Amos continua con su negocio de venta de repuestos, con esta actividad está logrando salir adelante junto con su familia y como su deseo es ampliar su negocio necesita aumentar sus artículos de venta, para la satisfacción de sus clientes.
El socio pertenece ala banco comunal "Santo Domingo" y solicito el crédito para comprar lunas de auto, muelles y aceite de carro.
El socio esta contento y agradecido infinitamente con los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito que le otorgaran y se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Amos continues in his business selling spare auto parts. With this job he is able to move forward together with his family. As he wishes to expand his business, he needs more product to sell, in order to satisfy his customers.

He belongs to the Santo Domingo communal bank. He seeks a loan to buy car windows, springs and oil. He is happy and infinitely grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan they are providing him, and he promises to be punctual with his payments.

loans.use: buy windows, springs and oil for cars.

loans.name: Saripudin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Saripudin, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in Serang, located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his family and his child. He owns a stall where he sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He joined Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to improve his business, as well as how to give more contribution to his community. He feels happy as well because the sales executive is being kind and helpful to him.

As the business grows, Saripudin is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and, accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Saripudin is the one who is seen in the photo. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to those who need access to such services.

loans.name: Las Dulces Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Dulces” está conformado por 06 socias de la misma zona se conocen entre sí, responsables con distintas actividades comerciales y con muchas ganas de trabajar y prosperar. Carmen de 35 años, es separada madre de dos hijas una de ellas cursa estudios superiores. Hace un año que implemento su negocio de venta de dulces en una zona muy transitada. El mayor anhelo de Carmen es seguir apoyando a su hija con sus estudios superiores. Solicito el crédito para comprar más mercadería de dulces (galletas, caramelos, chicles, frugos, gaseosas, etc.). El grupo “Las Dulces “agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles el crédito. Carmen es la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto viste polo color negro y pantalón jean.
texts.en:
The group “Las Dulces” is made up of 6 members from the same area that know each other. They are responsible for different commercial activities, and have a great desire to work and prosper. Carmen is 35 years old. She is separated and is the mother of two girls. One is in high school.

One year ago Carmen started her snack business in a well traveled area. Her greatest desire is to continue supporting her daughter with her upper level studies. She seeks a loan to buy more snack merchandise (cookies, candies, gum, juices, sodas, etc.)

The group "Las Dulces" is grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing loans. Carmen is the first from the left in the photo, and is dressed in a black shirt and jeans.

loans.use: to buy snack merchandise (cookies, candies, gum, juices, sodas, etc.)

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 40 and a married mother of 19 and 15-year-old sons.

The reason why she's applying for your financial help is that she needs to pay for the tuition/dorm fees of the older son, who is studying far from home.

These past two years, Aldelina has been doing agriculture on the 3.5 dynym land her family owns and she rents from other villagers about 5.5 more dynym. In addition to the cherry orchards, she plants tomatoes, peppers, and peas. All in all, the annual gross earnings goes up to USD 2,750 from cherries, USD 750 from peas, USD 1,200 from tomatoes, and USD 650 from peppers.

While her source of income is agriculture, her husband works in their village, a big village, with a construction company, for a monthly pay of USD 354.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition/dorm fees of her 19-year-old son.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Shown in the photo with her husband, Nasreen is a happily married woman. Some years ago she decided to support her family by starting a home tailoring business since her husband's income was barely enough to cover their day-to-day expenses.

Nasreen is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a lack of materials, she is facing difficulty covering the daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a murabaha-type loan of 35,000 PKR.

With her requested loan, Nasreen wants to purchase materials such as thread of different colors, lace, zippers, and cloth so she can sew more dresses on time. She hopes to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials such as thread of different colors, lace, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is 29 years old, married and has a child. His wife is pregnant and the child goes to kindergarten. His family lives in the Baku region, but Elchin’s family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli region. Elchin is a salesman, has a store and he sells plumbing and construction products in the store. He has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,750 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is planning to buy more products to sell with this amount. Elchin says, “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Germán tiene 37 años y tres hijos por quienes velar, el se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi  en una empresa, con esta actividad el sale adelante y aporta en su hogar.
El socio desea mejorar su servicio a sus clientes y viajar seguro por eso el solicito el crédito para comprar repuestos de auto.
El socio Germán necesita comprar llantas y lunas de carro.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pan, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant, venta de golosinas, 
Los socios están agradecidos y satisfechos con el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the communal bank "Señor de Muruhuay." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Germán is 37 years old and has three children to look after. He works providing taxi service in a business. With this business he moves forward and contributes to his household. His desire is to better his service to his customers and travel safely. For that reason Germán seeks a loan to buy auto repair parts. He needs to buy tires and windows.

The other members work in the sale of bread, the sale of animals, a grocery store, a restaurant, and the sale of candies. The members are grateful and satisfied with the loan offered through the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires and windows for his car.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) in the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and dealing with customers in the shop.

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products. And they are able to earn enough to meet the expenses of their 4 children. Currently, she has requested a murabaha-type loan of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase more grocery items such as grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea so she can cater to maximum customers and generate a healthier income.

Sobia is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 33-year-old, married woman, running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo).

She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has four children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

Rabia has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase one more buffalo, to increase milk sales and earn a good amount of income, to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia, age 35, is a housewife and a working woman as well. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides tailoring services to the people in the area where she is residing. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for the business, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and effectively. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult to do so. So Nazia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Nazia is much thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her tailoring services business.

loans.name: José

texts.es: El señor José es casado, tiene cinco hijos, comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería cuando tenia 9 años y estudio hasta cuarto grados. En la comunidad donde habita el señor José no hay luz eléctrica y se tiene que estar alumbrando con candiles y candelas, es por eso que él quiere un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar que vendría a ser un bien de gran utilidad ya que él quiere dejar de usar los candiles que son un peligro para la salud. El señor José Santo estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra del panel solar.
texts.en:
José is married and has five children. He began to work in agriculture and cattle when he was 9 years old. He went to school until the fourth grade.

In the community where José lives there are no electric lights, and they rely on candles and oil lamps. For that reason he wants a loan to purchase a solar system. It would be a benefit with great utility as he would like to quit using oil lamps since they are dangerous to his health. José Santo would be very grateful if he is provided the opportunity of a loan for the purchase of a solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a 40 watt solar system with 3 installed lights.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 29-year-old, hardworking woman. She is living with her husband and three children. She is working as a cook in a restaurant. Meanwhile, since 2000, her husband has been running his own tile and stone shop and is interested in continuing to grow his business. As both of them are working so hard to provide for the household expenses, they have not been able to give enough time to their children for the past few days.

Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva Field Partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's tile and stone shop. He will be using this amount to purchase more materials like tiles, stones, and a tile cutting machine from different cities like Peshawar and Lahore. As a result, her husband will be able to provide a greater variety of services to his clients and increase his net income and savings.

Sidra wants to live a good and simple life with her family. She wishes to renovate her house, to provide quality education to all of her children, and to fulfill all of the other basic needs of her family. She prays a lot for her children's better future and her husband's good health. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like tiles, stones, and a tile cutting machine for her husband's tiles shop

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is 51 years old and married. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Rashida has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. With her loan, she wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 45 years old and a married mother of 7 children. She is shown in the photo with her husband. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her milk sales business. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Maryam has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR in order to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. She will be able to earn a better profit, allowing her to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

Maryam aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada De Tupac Amaru Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “virgen purificada de tupac Amaru”; este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Nancy es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, ella se dedica a su negocio de venta de colchones y mantas. Con esta actividad ella saca adelante a sus dos hijos, que son la razón y motivo de que ella trabaje desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
La socia tiene 43 años y tiene ganas de seguir mejorando su negocio por eso desea aumentar su mercadería.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar colchones.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales. 
Los socios están satisfechos con el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA y se comprometen a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru" communal bank. It is located in the district of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco.

Nancy is an enterprising, hardworking person. She works selling mattresses and blankets. With her business she moves her two children forward. They are the reason and motivation for her working from 8 in the morning to 7 at night. She is 43 years old and has the desire to continue improving her business. For that reason she wants to increase her merchandise. She seeks a loan to buy mattresses.

The other members work in the sale of handicrafts, the sale of clothes, a grocery store, and the sale of animals. The members are satisfied with the loan offered by the Kiva investors and promise to make their payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy mattresses.

loans.name: Mauricio Ernesto

texts.es: Mauricio es un hombre trabajador que vive con su madre de 48 años de edad a la que brinda todo su apoyo y cariño, con ella vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años. Él tiene 31 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios de mecánico en una maquila, donde repara las maquinas utilizadas para la elaboración de ropa. La vivienda de Mauricio tiene el piso deteriorado, como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para mejorar el piso de su vivienda y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su madre.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a hardworking man who lives with his 48 year old mother to whom he provides his support and love. He lives with her in a house he has owned for a number of years. He is 31 years old and works providing services as a mechanic in a factory where they repair machines used to make clothes.

The floor of Mauricio's home is deteriorating, as can be seen in the photograph. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy brick flooring, cement, sand and gravel to improve the floor of his home and provide a better quality of life to his mother.

loans.use: to buy brick flooring, cement, sand and gravel to improve the floor of his home and provide a better quality of life to his mother.

loans.name: Landi

texts.en: Landi, this ethnic Egyptian Albanian man, is back needing your financial help again to buy materials that his wife, a seamstress, needs and also to repair his vehicle that he uses as a taxi.

loans.use: to buy fabric as raw material for his wife who stitches and repairs clothes; and to repair the vehicle he uses to earn income by transporting people

loans.name: Noreena

texts.en:
Day by day, increasing expenditures compelled Noreena to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 22 years old and is a married woman doing business with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years.

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. Noreena is a mother of 3 children. She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Noreena has requested a murabaha-type loan of 20,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
It was hard for Shagufta to manage her household expenses, so she started her business selling animals in her community. Shagufta is a 28-year-old single lady, shown in the photo with her cousin.

She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

Shagufta has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Luchadoras De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: Soledad tiene 34 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos  dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa zapatos y zapatillas para niños y adultos de lunes a viernes. Los fines de semana expende  dulces en horas de la tarde. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más ropas zapatos y zapatillas por campaña navideña. El grupo “LUCHADORAS DE YANACOTO” agradece a los inversionistas  KIVA por el crédito brindado.  soledad es la primera persona parada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Soledad is 34 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has three dependent children. She makes a living selling clothes, shoes, and tennis shoes for children and adults, Monday through Friday. On weekends, she sells sweets in the afternoon. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more clothes, shoes, and tennis shoes for the Christmas season. The "Luchadoras de Yanacoto" Group is grateful for Kiva investors for the loan offered. Soledad is the first person from the left.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes and tennis shoes.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is shown in the photo with her brother; he has been doing a business selling fruit for many years. He is very enthusiastic in his work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family.

For the improvement of her brother's business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, oranges, and guavas to meet market demands consistently, which ultimately helps them earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, oranges and guavas to meet market demands consistently.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is 27 years old and is shown in the photo with her brother. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.

Some years ago Saiqa started her tailoring business in order to cover her household's expenses. Up to now, she has been working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Saiqa has now requested a murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses on time. This will also boost her earnings which she wishes to spend on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses on time.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana's husband has been scheduled for surgery and she is seeking your compassion and financial help to pay for his surgery and other related expenses.

"I am sad and depressed and physically exhausted of all what's been happening to my loved ones. My husband damaged the spine some months back and my older son is paralyzed since birth. I have to look after them. I find it too much to deal with: all the emotional turmoil I'm in, the physical demand from me, and also the financial. It's all too much," said Suzana while talking to the loan officer who recently visited her for a follow-up.

Suzana is in the photograph with her older son, David, who does labour work in an attempt to help the family. Suzana is being paid as a caretaker for her paraplegic son and her paralyzed husband.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's spine surgery.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 38-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should help her husband (also shown in the photo) to improve their financial condition. So she started a business selling cloth.

Nadia believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children with their education. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list.

Currently she needs a murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors so she can earn greater profits through their sale. This would lead her towards living a decent life and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 32 years old and is a married mother of 2 children. She has been successfully running a small bookstore with her husband (also shown in the photo) in a corner of their house. She offers various items for sale such as books, copies, pencils, etc. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Shakeela wants to grow her business, so she has requested a murabaha-type loan of 20,000 PKR to buy stationery items, packing material, books, and copies so she can meet increasing demand at her store.

Shakeela is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, packing materials, books, and copies.

loans.name: Zahira

texts.en:
Zahira is a 31-year-old married lady. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

Her husband runs a small general store in his community, where he sells kids' products such as diapers and bottles. He makes enough money to provide for his family.

To expand and improve her husband's business, however, Zahira has requested a loan from Murabaha in the amount of 35,000 PKR, which he will use to purchase additional stocks of good-quality diapers from the market at lower rates to increase his sales.

loans.use: to improve her husband's business by purchasing additional stocks of quality products.

loans.name: Muzrum

texts.en:
Muzrum is 54 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family of seven. She is trained in tailoring. She provides tailoring services from her house.

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for her work, including thread, needles, fabric, etc. This is very important for her to continue to work efficiently and effectively. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult to afford these items. Muzrum is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Muzrum is thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, needles, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Gullnaz

texts.en:
Gullnaz is 45 years old. She is a responsible mother of 4 daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to her customers from her house.

Gullnaz needs to purchase a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, cloth, and a sewing machine. This is very important for her to be able to continue her work efficiently and satisfy her clients.

However, due to a lack of money, Gullnaz finds it difficult. So she requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, which was then granted. Gullnaz is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gul  Bano

texts.en:
Financial constraints, along with the desire for a better life and high-quality education for her 3 children, are just a few of the factors that encouraged Gul Bano to start her own business of selling animals by securing a loan from Kashf Foundation. She is 32 years old and married (her husband is shown in the photo with her).

She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises the animals and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate additional income.

She needs to improve her business to help cover their household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PKR, which she would use to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional animals.

loans.name: Nelofer

texts.en:
Nelofer was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 36 years old and is a married woman who has been running a milk sales business for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo).

Nelofer has buffaloes, and she sells their milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

Nelofer has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a murabaha-type loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales. This will help her earn a good income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and increase milk sales.

loans.name: Gul Naz

texts.en:
Gul Naz is a hardworking lady. She initiated her business of selling milk because it was difficult to cover their household expenses with the small amount of income generated by her husband (who is also shown in the photo).

She is a 51-year-old married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production, and her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Her job is to look after the buffaloes and cows and to collect their milk. Together, both she and her husband support their family.

However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, she has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and to thereby provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to expand her business and attract more customers by purchasing an additional buffalo.

loans.name: Noshaad

texts.en:
Noshaad is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 3 children (one son is shown in the photo with her).

She is a vigorous lady, who for many years has been running a cloth purchase-and-sale business. Specifically, she buys cloth in various fabrics, colors and designs from the market at wholesale prices and then sells them to the people of her community for a profit. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business to meet her family's needs.

Now, she has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs in order to attract more customers and to expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan. Noshaad expects a boost in her earnings as a result of the loan and she plans to spend a portion of her expected profits on bettering her family members.

loans.use: to expand her business and attract more customers by purchasing a variety of additional cloth.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 36 years old and married; she is shown in the photo with her husband. She has been running her beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

Rabia needs to be able to consistently service more customers. That is why she has applied for a murabaha-type loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers so she can treat many customers at the same time.

Rabia is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will continue to move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers for treating many customers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Like many women in her area, financial constraints played an important factor in encouraging Amina to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan. Amina is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children.

In order to support her husband (also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family, she started a milk-selling business. She is known in her town for providing high-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated from her business.

However, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her sales and to generate more income so that she will be better able to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing another buffalo.

loans.name: Elimene

texts.fr: Elimene, 36 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a deux enfants. Elle revend des chaussures usagées. Cela fait déjà dix ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Elimene is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has two children.  She resells used shoes.  She has been involved in this activity for the past ten years.  She needs a loan to increase her stock of shoes.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Forbin

texts.fr: Forbin a 32 ans, il est célibataire, et il vit encore chez ses parents. Il revend des téléphones portables à petit prix depuis quatre ans. Faisant souvent face à des ruptures de stock, il demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de téléphones mobiles.
texts.en: Forbin is 32 years old, single, and he still lives with his parents.  He has been selling cellular phones at low prices for the past four years.  Since he is often out of stock, he is taking this micro-loan in order to increase his stock of cellular phones.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Apolonia Group

texts.es:
DUO SANTA APOLONIA
Doña Marta es originaria de la aldea las mejoranas, ella tiene 40 años de edad, ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de consumo diario y se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.
El esposo de ella se dedica al comercio comprando y vendiendo granadias, y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que entre los dos se están ayudando para salir adelante.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió para surtir su tienda y como también en compra de materia prima para sus tejidos, ya que doña Marta es bien conocida en el lugar por su tiendecita por la amabilidad que brinda a sus clientes.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de productos asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hija a estudiar para un mejor futuro, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles y materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos.
texts.en:
Duo Santa Apolonia: Marta is a native of the village of Las Mejoranas. She is 40 years old and she has a small store selling daily use items. She also works hand making traditional weavings.

Her husband works in commerce buying and selling granadias (a local fruit) and thanks to his support she continues forward with her business. And between the two of them helping each other they are getting ahead.

The loan that she received was invested to stock her store and also to buy raw material for her weaving. Marta is well known in the community for her store and the friendliness that she provides her clients.

She dreams of expanding her business more, stocking a greater variety of products and obtaining better profits and in the future having her daughter study for a better future. She is requesting this loan to buy food products and raw material to make her traditional weaving.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 52 years old and widowed with one child. Her one child still in school, Sally works very hard to provide for them.

Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, canned goods, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Sally has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Sally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, canned goods, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en:
Buhari is maize farmer from Anchau Gari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Buhari is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Buhari would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Buhari can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Buhari is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Chinkhowe Group

texts.en:
Gliseria is 47 years old and married. Her husband owns a business selling tomato.

Gliseria sells fritters for a living. she would like to buy flour, cooking oil and firewood to stock up her business. She started her business to support and alleviate her family from the hunger problems they were facing. the profits from her business will also help her to buy tomato and Irish potatoes for sell.

Her plan is to buy is to buy iron sheets and cement for her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and firewood to stock up her business

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en: Nim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es: Esmeralda es una mujer trabajadora de 23 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que cada día muestra sus deseos de superación, por lo que desde hace 3 años se dedica a cuidar de su tienda de productos básicos, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que ella desea solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros productos para su tienda de productos básicos.
texts.en: Esmeralda is a hard-working 23 year old woman. She lives in a house that she owns together with her 5 year old son. She is an admirable woman who every day demonstrates her desire to excel. This this reason she has worked for three years caring for her store selling basic products. It has allowed her to get ahead with her family. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in basic grains, dairy products, candies and drinks amongst other items for her basic product store.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, dairy products, candies and drinks amongst other items for her basic product store.

loans.name: Kabwazi Group

texts.en:
Esther is 29 years old. She is married witrh 4 children that depend on her.

Esther owns a butchery business. She would like to use this loan to buy a cow for her butchery business. She started the business to help support her family by providing food and paying school fees for her children. Esther finds that the business brings in good profits. She has employed 2 people that help with the activities of the business.

Her personal goal is to build a house and own a car and she hopes to open butchery shops in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her butchery business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 26, married, and has 2 children. He has a grocery store business and is requesting 4000 EGP to buy some grocery products such as oil, pasta and rice to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, pasta and rice. .

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia es casada, estudio hasta segundo grados y trabaja junto con su esposo en una finca sembrando hortalizas. En la comunidad donde habitan no hay energía eléctrica y se tienen que estar alumbrando con candiles y candelas es por eso que ella quisiera un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar que vendría a mejorar su calidad de vida ya que ellos desean dejar de usar los candiles que son muy peligrosos para la salud.  La señora Claudia estaría agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra del panel solar.
texts.en:
Claudia is married, completed studies until second grade and works with her husband in a farm growing vegetables.  In the community where they live there is no electricity, so they have to use oil lamps and candles for lighting.  As a result, Claudia would like to get a loan to purchase a solar energy system.  This will improve their quality of life as they would like to stop using oil lamps that are very dangerous to their health.  

Claudia would be grateful if she can have the opportunity to obtain this loan to purchase the solar energy system.

loans.use: to purchase and install a solar energy system of 65 watts with 3 lights.

loans.name: Kabale P. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is the Head Teacher of Kabale Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kabale with 1,000 students.

Kabale Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kabale Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Godfrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tichitenji Group

texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children and 2 relatives that depend on her. Her husband works as a truck driver.

Patricia is farming and selling vegetables for a living. She has requested this loan to buy fertilizer for her tomato garden. She started her business to become financially independent. The profits from the business help her to feed and pay school fees for her children.

Patricia plans to own a dwelling house and also hopes to own a farm in a couple of years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her tomato garden

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey was inspired to start a business in 2000 after having been unemployed for so long. He decided to sell part of his land to get starting capital for a boutique business. Godfrey is also involved in farming for supplementary income. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking good care of his family as the sole provider.

His business is challenged by the ever changing fashions and designs on the market plus customers who do not pay him on time. He dreams of owning a big shopping arcade in town and also employing many people. Given the Christmas season, Godfrey would like to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Kurujyejuru Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 33 years old and married with three children from 2 to 9 years old. In the photo, Rehema is holding a blue book. She owns a general business. Her working hours are from 6:00a.m. to 7:00p.m. Rehema is the president of the group in the picture, KURUJYEJURU, loosely translated as "GROWING UP."

Rehema has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to add more and various fruit products in her business, for example, passion fruit, oranges, and pineapples, which can increase her sales, thus making more profits.

With her children in mind, she works hard on a daily basis in order to pave a brighter future for them. Therefore, with the Kiva loan, it will help her on increasing her business, thus pay school fees for her children. And the children will have better well-being outcomes, for example, more healthier, warm meals, a decent education, and additional clothing, not forgetting their health.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits like bananas, passion fruit, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a motorcycle rider who is married with two children in Fort Portal. This is a business that employs many youth in Uganda, as it is locally called “Boda Boda.”

He has been in business for seven years but always complains of traffic charges given the fact that he has always been punished because he lacks a driving permit. He earns little yet he works for 12 hours a day and has to remit 80% of his earnings to the owner of the motorcycle. He dreams of buying his own motorcycle and later a car for a transport business.

Patrick does not want to close this year without getting a riding permit, hence he is requesting a loan to help him process a riding permit.

loans.use: process a riding permit.

loans.name: Dúo Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS MARGARITAS

Doña Margarita es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, Guatemala ella tiene 42 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos menores de edad, ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos de consumo diario.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer de camión y gracias al apoyo de ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en su tienda para surtirlo con más variedad de productos, ya que ella es bien conocida en el lugar y siempre es visitada por sus clientes.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio surtirlo con más variedad de productos así obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Duo Las Margaritas:

Margarita is a native of the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 42 years old and she is responsible for her children who are minors. She has a store selling daily use products.

Her husband works as a truck driver and thanks to his support she continues on with her business.

The loan that she received was invested in her store to stock it with a variety of products as she is well known in her community and is always visited by her clients.

She dreams of expanding her business more stocking it with a greater variety of products and thus obtaining more earnings and send her children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Rita Nelvia

texts.es: Rita tiene 52 años de edad y desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, en su casa de habitación, lo cual le permite estar pendiente de su familia. Ella es madre soltera y se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante con sus dos hijos una mayor de edad y una niña de 9 años de edad. Rita desea invertir en su negocio de venta de productos básicos, es por ello que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, champú, leche, golosinas, lácteos, entre otros productos para su tienda. Con el crédito solicitado anteriormente Rita logro mejorar su tienda, por lo que espera continuar mejorando con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Rita is 52 years old, and for 10 years she has sold basic products in her home, which allows her to keep an eye on her family. She is a single mother, and she makes a lot of effort to get ahead, along with her two children, one adult and a nine-year-old daughter.

Rita wants to invest in her business of selling basic products. It is for this reason that she has decided to apply to FUSAI for a loan to invest in basic grains, shampoo, milk, candies, and dairy products, among other products for her store.

With the loan she applied for previously, Rita managed to improve her store, and so she hopes to continue improving with this support.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, shampoo, milk, candies, and dairy products, among other products for her store.

loans.name: Saraswati Group

texts.en:
This group started in the year 2015 in Golamunda village of Nuapada district, Odisha, India. They are ten active, self-dependent women who intend to develop their businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses. Sasmita is one of those who have taken on a great role for her own development and the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing as the first person on the left with a raised hand in the photo.

Sasmita is about 33 years old. She lives with her small family: her husband and only son. Sasmita has been selling vegetables for the last 10 years. Her husband helps to promote the business. Through this business, the family earns a monthly income of 7,800 Indian rupees. In Sasmita’s opinion, with this small income it is very difficult to maintain a family. After that, to earn sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group to strengthen social relations and to take out a loan for the expansion of her business.

Sasmita plans to purchase tomatoes, cauliflower, chilly, potatoes, onion, garlic, zinger, cucumber, radish, carrot, capsicum, etc. Sasmita hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and to save money to provide a better education for her son.

The other nine members of the group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged with different businesses, such as a dairy, animal trading, grocery shop, betel shop and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase tomato, cauliflower, chilly, potatoes, onion, garlic, zinger, cucumber, radish, carrot, capsicum, etc., for her store

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: El señor Isidro es casado y tiene cuatro hijos,  él se dedica a trabajar en una finca junto con su esposa sembrando granos básicos, engordando cerdo, tiene ganado y cosechan cacao, el señor Isidro no estudio ya que que no habían maestro en la zona, por lo tanto a temprana edad se dedico a aprender las labores del campo. El señor Isidro apoya a sus hijos en los estudios. En la comunidad donde habitan no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar para que este sea instalado en la casa de habitación, el cual será de mucha utilidad para todos los miembros del hogar ya que sus hijos están estudiando y podrán hacer las tareas por las noches, él se podrá alumbrar por las noches y las madrugadas para realizar la comida de las personas que le ayudan a sembrar y ordeñar, él estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Señor Isidro is married and has four children. He works on a farm along with his wife, planting basic grains and raising pigs. He has cattle, and they harvest cacao. Señor Isidro didn't go to school, since there weren't teachers in the zone, and so he learned farm work at an early age.

Señor Isidro supports his children in their education. In the community where they live, there is no electric light. It is for this reason that he is applying for a loan to purchase a solar power system so that it can be installed in his home, which will be very useful for all the members of the household, since his children are in school, and they will be able to do their homework at night. He will be able to have light at night and in the early morning to prepare the food for the people who help him to plant and to milk. He will be very grateful if you offer him the opportunity to have this loan for the purchase of a solar power system.

loans.use: to purchase a 100-watt solar power system with four installed lights.

loans.name: Hipa

texts.en:
Hipa started selling home baked goods from her home while she gained chef training and ‎underwent business management courses at her local small business association. She ‎knew she had the talent and the determination to own her own restaurant. Hipa opened a ‎unique restaurant, catering to college students and area offices providing home cooked, ‎ethnic dishes.
