She opened her restaurant near the local college in a busy area of ‎businesses and banks.‎

Hipa needed this loan to assist with renovations, plumbing and electrical upgrades.‎

Hipa wants to see her restaurant grow. While she has competing restaurants in her area, ‎she has succeeded in differentiating her place by providing unique dishes and cuisine. ‎Hipa wants to see her business grow and her grown children thrive.

loans.use: with renovations, plumbing and electrical upgrades.‎

loans.name: Dúo Dany De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
DUO DANY DE SANTO TOMAS
Este dúo está formado por doña Julia Imelda,  ella tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario como azúcar, cereal, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, arroz , pastas, detergente, leche, frijoles volteados, chiles rellenos, en su tienda ubicada en su domicilio desde ya hace unos años, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercaderia de temporada navideña, así como abarrotes en general para surtir su tienda y tener todos los productos necesarios para sus clientes en esta temporada.
texts.en:
DUO DANY DE SANTO TOMAS

This duo was formed by Doña Julia Imelda. She is 27 years old and sells products for daily use such as sugar, grains, candies, soda water, rice, pasta, detergent, milk, refried beans, and stuffed chiles in her store, which has been located in her home for several years.

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of merchandise for the Christmas season, as well as groceries in general to stock her store and have all the necessary products for her customers in this season.

loans.use: to buy food products and seasonal Christmas merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Hasae's Group

texts.en:
Hasae is an enterprising lady. She is standing in the middle of the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four including her husband and her two daughters. Hasae is a poultry farmer by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all their basic necessities.

The major problem that concerns Hasae is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon an open field to attend to nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very sensible lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So, in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, Hasae and her group members are requesting a loan of 45,000 Indian rupees. She will use her portion of the loan to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce medical expenses.

Hasae is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Kitagata S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Samuel. He is the Head Teacher of Kitagata S. School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kitagata in Sheema with 1200 students. 

Kitagata S. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining UV water and Tulip filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will, therefore, save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water and Tulip Filtration water treatment systems with a 1000 litre tank and 5 sets of 20 litre buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kitagata S. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Samuel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Yaneth Azucena

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive Yaneth junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad, es muy humilde y sencilla. Ella es muy trabajadora y se dedica a prestar sus servicios varios, con lo cual logra sostener a su familia, desde hace 2 años. Yaneth con el crédito anterior logro mejorar parte del techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, polines y pines para continuar mejorando su vivienda, ya que aún tiene filtraciones en algunas partes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The home where Yaneth lives, along with her life companion and their two children, ages 15 and 11, is very humble and simple. She is very hard-working and she offers various services, with which she has managed to sustain her family for two years.

With the previous loan, Yaneth managed to improve part of the roof of their home, for which she is applying to FUSAI for a new loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, purlins, and pins to continue improving their home, since she still has leaks in some parts of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, purlins, and pins to continue improving her home.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn, 42, is from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Elvin, an OFW. When their only child reached College, Ginalyn thought of putting up a small general store by their house. It will help augment their income to fully support her child's education and meet their daily needs.

She is encouraged that her business has been doing well for the last two years.To help her sustain and expand her store, she is seeking your help in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. to sell. She trusts that you will grant her request.

Ginalyn dreams of seeing her child become a professional someday. She believes that a good College Education will help her child find a good job and lead to a better life.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Jagadamba Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, eleven self-dependent women of Charpali village, Nuapada district, Odisha, India, formed a group named Jagadamba. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Sabhya is the most active and energetic lady of this village. She has taken the lead to form a self help group. She is the lady, age about 30 years, seated as the first person on the left with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and one daughter.

For the last eight years, Sabhya has been running a dairy business with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of 7,200 Indian rupees from her occupation. But her present income is not sufficient to manage business expenses as well as household expenses for the family. So she has decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business with a loan. She will purchase two cows. Through this, Sabhya hopes she will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for better education for her daughter and the construction of a good house.

The other ten members of the group are engaged in different small businesses, such as vegetable vending, a dairy, general store, tailoring, betel shop, animal trading, etc.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es originaria de San Juan de Abajo y hace más de 23 años que vive en Cuastecomatillo ya que de ese lugar es su esposo, ahí nacieron sus dos hijos y debido a que la familia de Rigoberto es ejidataria, en su totalidad se han dedicado a la agricultura en la siembra de frijol principalmente.
Desde hace ya diez años que adquirieron el solar en donde hoy viven, y debido a que siempre han luchado por tener su propia casa, decidieron hacer un cuarto con tablas de madera y lamina galvanizada. 
A ellos les gusta mucho el lugar en donde vive ya que predomina la tranquilidad y es un lugar con una riqueza extraordinaria de agua que brota de un manantial muy cercano.
Consideran que lo único malo es la escasez de trabajo en el tiempo en que las lluvias prevalecen pues el campo no permite sembrar ningún producto.
Además no cuentan con los servicios públicos como teléfono e internet, ni escuelas de nivel medio superior.
Sus hijos estudian actualmente en una escuela de nivel medio superior que se encuentra a 30 minutos de ese lugar, por lo que todos los días se tienen que trasladar hasta su escuela y al regresar Rigoberto ayuda a su papá e Itzel a su mamá con las labores del campo y del hogar respectivamente.
El principal problema que hasta el momento consideran les ha afectado, es la falta de una vivienda adecuada pues de alguna manera no deja de haber animales venenosos como serpientes, alacranes o arañas. Y al tener una vivienda más adecuada les brindará seguridad, mejores condiciones de salud, y sobre todo tranquilidad.
El joven Rigoberto piensa estudiar para médico veterinario e Itzel para enfermera. Todos luchan día a día por hacer esto una realidad ya que consideran es lo mejor para todos ellos.
Finalmente Elvira comparte que viven una vida muy feliz y considera tener una familia muy unida, para ellos el campo les permite convivir día a día.  Su momento favorito es irse a comer bajo la sombra de un árbol y con el olor agradable que la naturaleza del campo les brinda.  
El mayor sueño de Elvira es que su familia viva en una casa apropiada donde cada uno tenga su espacio propio, cuyas paredes no sean de tablas de madera frágiles y el  techo no sea de lámina. Un lugar construido con fuertes cimientes como las que quiere que sus hijos contruyan para su vida.
texts.en:
Elvira is originally from San Juan de Abajo but has lived in Cuastecomatillo for more than 23 years.  Cuastecomatillo is her husband Rigoberto's hometown and their two children were born there.  Given that Rigoberto's family members are common land holders, Elvira and him have made a living solely from Agriculture, mainly in the planting and harvesting of beans.  Ten years ago they acquired the land that they live in and, since they have always striven to have their own home, they decide to build a room with wooden boards and galvanized sheets.  

Elvira and her family enjoy where they live very much given that it is a very quiet place with extraordinary riches due to the water that flows from a nearby spring.  They consider that the only bad thing there is the lack of work during rainy season given that they cannot plant any product.  In addition they don't have public services such as telephone and internet nor junior high schools.  Their children are now studying in a school that is 30 minutes away from their home.  Everyday they go to school and when they return, Rigoberto helps his father with work in the fields and Itza helps her mother with house chores.  The main problem that they consider has affected them so far is the lack of a proper home as they are currently exposed to poisonous snakes, scorpions and spiders.  A proper home will bring them security, improved health and peacefulness above all.  

Rigoberto, junior would like to study to become a veterinarian and Itza would like to become a nurse.  They all struggle every day to make this a reality as they understand this would be the best for all of them.  Finally, Elvira shares that they live a very happy life and she considers that she has a very united family.  For them, the country allows them to live together day by day.  

Elvira's favorite  moment is to go and eat under the shadow of a tree and enjoy the wonderful smells that nature brings along,  Elvira's dream is that her family can live in a proper home where each can have its own space, where the walls are not built out of fragile wood boards and where the roof is not made out of sheet.  A place built with strong foundations like the ones she would like her children to build for their lives.

loans.use: to give her family a proper house to live.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married with five children, four of whom attend school in Fort Portal-Uganda. He works on 2 businesses; selling fresh foods and a motorcycle transport business. He has been in business since 2012 and is all smiles about the progress he has attained so far.

He is requesting a loan to buy fresh foods like yellow bananas and tomatoes for selling. As we approach the Christmas season the demand is high.

Patrick has a business dream of transforming his transport business from a motorcycle to a taxi business to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like yellow bananas and tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Pierre Claudette

texts.fr: Claudette est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants.  Elle prépare et revend des fritures au bord de la route principale de son quartier. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter de l’huile et des ingrédients culinaires.
texts.en: Claudette is 31 years old. She is married and has five children. She cooks fritters to sell by the main road of her neighborhood. She is seeking this loan in order to buy food and cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to buy oil and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Finette

texts.fr: FINETTE a 41 ans. Elle est mariée et a quatre enfants.  Elle revend de la nourriture au bord de la route principale de son quartier de d’habitation. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter du riz et de l’huile.
texts.en: Finette is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells cooked food along the main road in her neighborhood. She is seeking this loan to buy rice and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil.

loans.name: Mimause

texts.fr: Mimause est de âgée de 44 ans ans. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite boutique de produits alimentaires. On peut y trouver du riz, de la farine, du sucre, des œufs et bien d’autres produits alimentaires. Elle cherche un prêt pour acheter des boites d’œufs et du sucre.
texts.en: Mimause is 44 years old. She owns a small grocery store offering rice, flour, sugar, eggs and many other food items. She is seeking this loan to buy cartons of eggs as well as sugar.

loans.use: to buy cartons of eggs as well as sugar.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida, sus dos hijas de 19 y 17 años y un varón de 10 años de edad. Él presta sus servicios de jornalero, con lo cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Alfredo desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda y para ello solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines y clavos para mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alfredo is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two daughters ages 19 and 17 years old, and a son age 10 years old. He works as a laborer, which has helped him get ahead with his family with a lot of effort and dedication. Alfredo wants to improve the roof in his house, thus he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting, poles, pins, and nails to improve the roof in his house.

loans.use: Buy galvanized sheeting, poles, pins, and nails to improve the roof on his house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: El señor Isabel es casado,tiene 2 hijos, él estudio hasta segundo grado, ya que los maestros dejaron de llegar a dar clase a la comunidad, por lo que se dedico desde muy joven a aprender las labores del campo. Actualmente el trabaja con su compañera sembrando granos básicos y cosechando cacao en unas tierras que ellos tienen, el señor Isabel apoya siempre a sus hijos en los estudios, en la comunidad donde vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar para que este sea instalado en la casa de habitación, el cual será de gran utilidad para todos los miembros del hogar ya que sus hijos están estudiando y podrán hacer las tareas por las noches,él se podrá alumbrar por las noches y las madrugadas para realizar la comida de las personas que le ayudan a sembrar. El señor Isabel estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en: Mr. Isabel is married, with 2 children. He studied through second grade because teachers stopped coming to his community to teach. This is why he dedicated himself, since very young, to work in the fields. Currently he works with his partner growing basic grains and growing cacao in some land owned by them. Mr. Isabel always supports his children in their studies, In the community where they live,  there is no electricity, that is why he is asking for a loan to purchase a solar panel system so that he can install it in his house. This will be of great use to all their household members because his children are  studying and can do their homework at night. He can also use it to illuminate at night and to cook for his farm workers in the early morning. Mr. Isabel is very grateful for the opportunity given to buy a solar panel system.

loans.use: Buy a solar panel system of 100 watts, with four light fixtures installed.

loans.name: Afaayo Development Group  Biina Mutungo

texts.en:
Gaddafi is a repeat client with Ugafode Microfinance. He is a married man with children.

He is a businessman who owns a retail shop and and also rides a motorcycle to supplement his family income. He is faced with the challenges of competition and limited capital. In a bid to increase his working capital and expand the business, he has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX.

Gaddafi is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to him, since he is now able to fund his business.

loans.use: to service his boda boda

loans.name: Urufatiro Tcb Sub B Group

texts.en: URUFATIRO is a group led by FITINA who is 35 years old. The group name means “Foundation” in English. She is married with three children between 7 and 15 years old; they all go to school. She has a restaurant and has been doing business for the past 4 years. The group members sell different items and they all want their lives changed. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava, and meat to sell. With the profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cassava, and meat to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a farmer who grows rice, bananas and tomatoes to generate income for personal development like buying assets. In order to have big harvests, he also rents rice fields which supplement what he has harvested to make big sales. He has been in business since 2011. He has managed to make a lot of friends and employment opportunities for many people.

However, his business is at risk because of the challenges of the price fluctuation of rice and expensive labor. His dream is to buy more land and a tipper lorry to transport his rice to his customers.

Julius is now requesting a loan to rent rice fields to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent rice fields to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai owns a small greenhouse farm in Kardashinka. He launched his agricultural business 10 years ago and has been growing it steadily ever since. Today Nikolai has greenhouses on 37 ares of land growing early and late vegetables, mostly tomatoes and cucumbers. Nikolai is 30 and married with young kids.

Nikolai has long hoped to construct two new greenhouses to add to his farming unit. He is hoping to invest 40 000 Grivnyas in this project.  He will cover newly built greenhouses with plastic for the new farming season. Nikolai is full of ideas and energy. He is willing and ready to work hard and invest all his efforts in further development of his farming business.

loans.use: to build two new greenhouses.

loans.name: Urufatiro Tcb Sub Grp A Group

texts.en: URUFATIRO is a group led by Odette who is 51 years old. The group name means “Foundation” in English. She is married with four children between 13 and 29 years old; they all go to school. She has a shop and has been doing in a business for the past 9 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice for sell.

loans.name: Atanasi

texts.en:
Atanasi is in need of a loan to buy maize and beans to sell. He is a very hardworking man, married with 5 children and living in Fort Portal. For the last 5 years, Atanasi has managed rentals as an additional source of income. He got involved in the this businesses to earn income to support his family, especially to pay for basic needs and educating the children.

Atanasi's business dream is to become a leading produce dealer in his area and to provide his children with university education so they can obtain degrees and employment. He faces the challenge of untrustworthy customers who fail to pay him on time. Atanasi planted rice for commercial purposes with his previous loan, which is almost ready for harvesting.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
This is Cornelius, a full time student at Rongo University currently studying Communication and Journalism, and he is in his last year. He is 25 years old.

Cornelius has been paying school fees through well-wishers in the past, but now he needs support to pay for school fees and his general upkeep i.e. rent, stationery and meals to be able to attend school. With a Kiva loan, he will be able to complete his education.

He is thankful to the partners who will support him to get this loan, and he promises to use it wisely and repay promptly.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and non-tuition costs.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Denis a resident of Fort Portal and he is married with 2 children. Denis operates a retail shop, working for 12 hours a day. The desire for self-employment caused him to start up the business. He is targeting the festive season, where he expects to make big sales as everyone will be shopping for the holidays. He is requesting a loan to buy retail items like sugar, soap, and beers for sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy retail items like sugar, soap, and beers to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a farmer from Gladkovka. She grows early vegetables on her land lot of 0.47 hectare in both greenhouses and under cover. Valentina has a big farm unit growing tomatoes, peppers, Chinese cabbage, corn, and radish. She has been working in the sphere of agriculture for 39 years already. Valentina is 62 at the moment. 
Valentina is getting ready to prepare her greenhouses for a new farming season. She needs to buy specific fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, wood, etc. which is why she needs an additional 40 000 Grivnyas. Valentina is planning to use generated income to expand her farming unit and help support her family meeting their immediate needs.

loans.use: to buy specific fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, and wood.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla, age 40, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roger, a mason, and they have one elementary school child. In a developing economy like the Philippies, a mason's salary is not enough to support a family.   

Perla has been operating a small general store and ready to wear clothes business for eight years already. It helps augment their income and meet their daily needs. She buys grocery supplies and clothes at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. 

To help her expand her business, she is seeking a PHP 50,000 loan to fill her small store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil, and toiletries. Part of the loan she will use to buy several ready to wear clothes to sell in their community, especially with Christmas just around the corner. She expects a higher demand of grocery items and Ready-To-Wear.

Perla wishes to grow her store and have her own slot at the town's market. She prays for God to give them good health and and abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and Ready-to-Wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rabha

texts.en:
Rabha always worked in agriculture in the past. When her sons finished high school, the idea grew ‎of opening an ice cream parlor/cafe which would also sell fruit shakes, specialty hot ‎drinks and ice cream. She wanted to develop a business where her sons could also ‎work and earn an income. With time, she worked, saved up and opened her business.

‎Now, with this loan, she is opening her second branch. She has registered her business ‎and is working to see its ongoing success.‎

She needs this loan for shake and ice cream machines for the new branch.‎

Rabha has succeeded in developing a business and has created an enterprise where her sons ‎can also work. She is working to help them to get their education and to develop a strong, stable ‎business.‎

loans.use: to acquire shake and ice cream machines for the new branch.‎

loans.name: St. Stephen Primary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda!

This is Florence. She is the Head Teacher of St. Stephen Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Buikwe with 600 students. St. Stephen Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Stephen Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Florence ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 65 years old, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leopoldo, a motorized tricycle driver. All of their children are married and have families of their own. It is common in Filipino culture that some grown children with families still live with their parents until they can afford to live on their own.

Ninfa has a tricycle which her husband drives. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short-distance travel. Ninfa also owns videoke machines, as shown in her photo, that she rents during occasions like birthdays, Christmas, New Year's Eve, and wedding parties.

Proper and regular maintenance of Ninfa's tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this, she is humbly seeking your help and requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to pay for new tires and other spare parts for her tricycle. She will also use the loan to buy a new videoke machine. She expects more people will be renting her machine, as Christmas is fast-approaching and everyone will be in a merry mood and will have sing-alongs at parties.

Ninfa wishes to help her children buy their own houses for their families. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her weekly work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for her tricycle maintenance and buy a new videoke machine to rent.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmytryi is a farming businessman from Gladkovka. He has had rich experiences working in the sphere of agriculture. He has been a farmer for 24 years. Dmytryi was born in rural part of Ukraine and got used to living in a village. His background is the main reason for his choice of business.

Today, Dmytryi grows early and late tomatoes, cucumbers, radish, and zucchini on 33 acres of land. In addition, Dmytryi has a 5.72 lot hectares where he grows sunflowers and small grains. Dmytryi is 55 and married with grown kids.

Dmytryi is hoping to use 38,000 UAH to buy plastic film to recover greenhouses and repair them, as well as to buy seeds to plant this upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy plastic film to recover greenhouses and repair them, as well as to buy seeds to plant this upcoming season.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 54 years old. She is married with six children aged between 14 and 26 years. They all go to school and they are in technical schools. She is a teacher and she has been doing business for the past 6 years. Her husband is a teacher also. She is requesting a school fees loan and she would like to pay in installments. After paying school fees, she plans to make more savings in same business.

loans.use: to pay in installments

loans.name: Kiwalazi P. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Aidah. She is the Head teacher of Kiwalazi Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Irongo in Iganga district with 700 students. Kiwalazi P. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term because the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a Tulip Filtration water treatment system with 5 Sets of 20 liter buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kiwalazi P. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Aidah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as, increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos la mayor es una niña de 13 años y el menor un niño de 2 años de edad a los que busca siempre la manera de brindar lo mejor. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace 10 años, por lo que es muy conocida en su cantón como una mujer trabajadora. El piso de la vivienda de Rosa es de tierra lo cual causa enfermedades respiratorias a sus hijos, por lo que ella ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible evitando de esta manera que las enfermedades respiratorias deterioren la salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in her own house together with her life partner and their two children. The older one is a 13-year-old girl and the younger one is a little boy of two years of age. For them she is always trying to deliver the best.
She has offered her domestic services for ten years, that´s why she is well-known in her canton as a hard-working woman.
The floor of her home is made of earth, which causes respiratory diseases in her children. That´s why she decided to apply to FUSAI for a loan to buy: cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home as soon as possible and thus to avoid that the respiratory diseases harm the health of her children.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home, to avoid respiratory diseases  in her children.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 26-year-old married man living in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. His wife is unemployed and he is the only breadwinner in the family. Gocha works as a consultant at a building company. He wants to find a way to increase productivity and be involved in the trading business.

Gocha requested financial support for a start-up business and was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which gives poor people a chance to start or restart their own businesses. Gocha plans to use his loan to start his business trading fruits and vegetables. He will purchase a stock of products and have money for working capital.

The loan will be great help to this motivated man and his family, as his income will greatly increase and Gocha will get the chance to tackle his financial instability.

loans.use: To start trading business with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna started working in the agricultural business 20 years ago. Today, she's grown to be an experienced farmer with serious potential and a stable income. Inna grows early and late vegetables in her greenhouses on 0.65 hectare. Her main crops are cucumbers, potatoes, and Chinese cabbage. In addition, Inna has a few cows. She milks them and sells the milk wholesale every day. Inna is 37 and married with 1 son, who now attends school.

Inna is planning to invest 20,000 UAH in construction of a new greenhouse that will replace the old one that has been falling apart after many years of use. She is hoping to invest the leftover 10,000 UAH to purchase fertilizers and pest control chemicals.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse and to buy fertilizers and pest control chemicals.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en:
Liliya is a farmer from Tavriyskoye. She owns a big lot of land: over 6 hectares of black soil. Liliya uses her land to grow early vegetables in greenhouses, including tomatoes, potatoes, and eggplants. She has been running this business for 5 years. She is 36.

Liliya is hoping to use 40,000 UAH loan to buy supplies for the upcoming farming season, including polyethylene film, agrotextile, seeds, fertilizers, and wood. She believes these items will help get her greenhouses ready for a new season of planting and growing vegetables for next spring.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the upcoming farming season, including polyethylene film, agrotextile, seeds, fertilizers, and wood.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 37 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 21 овца и 3 лошади. Корма для скота заготавливают сами, выращивая кукурузу и люцерну. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). Жазгул является лидером группы "Куз", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Жазгул решила развить ее бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Zhazgul is 37, married, and a mother of two. She has a high school education and has been a farmer since 2000. She has 2 cows, 21 sheep, and 3 horses. They grown corn and alfalfa to use as feed for the livestock. The business earns 11,000 som (KGS) per month. Zhazgul is the leader of the "Kuz" group, which consists of three members. She decided to develop her business and applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She will use the earnings from the loan to continue developing her business and to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a Lebanese woman living in Beirut. She opened her grocery store in 2012 and has been managing it on her own ever since.

Huda is 40 years old, married, and living with her husband and their three children whom all attend school. Her husband works in wholesale trading, which allows him to cover most of the household and kids' expenses.

Huda graduated from school as an A student, but due to her family's financial situation, she was not able to purse a university degree. Since she opened her store, Huda has become very well-known in the area where she works and she has built herself a very good reputation for being friendly and offering competitive prices.

For the first time, Huda is asking for a 1,029,765 LBP loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy food products and cleaning products for her grocery store. She believes that by taking the loan, she will be able to improve her sales and increase her income. Her main motivation is to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and cleaning products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Shaiyrbek

texts.ru: Шайырбек, 25 лет, женат, есть сын. У него среднее образование, с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством. У него в хозяйстве есть 12 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). Шайырбек участник группы "Куз", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Он обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Shaiyrbek is 25, married, and has a son. He has a high school education and has been a farmer since 2010. He has 12 cows and 10 sheep and his business earns 14,000 som (KGS) per month. Shaiyrbek is a member of the "Kuz" group, which consists of three people. He applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. He will use the earnings from the loan to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to invest in his business

loans.name: Yangali Group

texts.fr: Véronique est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est gérante d'un Kiosque de PMUB (loterie Burkinabé) dans son quartier et cela fait 15 ans de cela qu'elle exerce son activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour aménager son lieu d'activité afin d'attirer plus de clientèle. Dans le quartier de Véronique elle est la seule a vendre des ticket de PMUB ce qui fait que la vente de ses tickets marche bien en plus de cela elle accueille bien ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 3 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Véronique is forty-three years old, married and mother to four children. She has been running a PMUB kiosk (selling national lottery tickets) in her neighbourhood for fifteen years.

This loan will be used to improve her business and attract more customers. At the moment, Véronique is the only person selling PMUB tickets in her area and this helps her to sell lots of tickets. She is also very welcoming to her customers.

Following this loan Véronique's profits will allow her to take care of her family, continue her business and increase her savings level. She has had three previous loans which were all repaid on time.

loans.use: to improve her business premises.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.fr: Anasthasie est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. c'est une brave femme elle représente les autres  membres du groupe. elle vend du gâteau dans son quartier et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de farine de blé, 02 sacs de sucre et autres ingrédients pour faire ses gâteaux et vendre. Elle fait bien ses gâteaux, elle est propre et accueille bien ses clients sans distinction ce qui fait bien marché la vente de ses gâteaux. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargne, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser à la bonne date à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Anasthasie is thirty-four years old, married and has two children. She is a strong woman who represents the other women in her group. She has been selling cakes in her area for ten years.

Anasthasie is requesting this loan to buy ten sacks of wheatflour, two sacks of sugar and other ingredients to make cakes for sale. She is very skilled, keeps her premises very clean and offers a warm welcome to her customers. The profits she makes from selling these cakes will increase her savings level, allow her to take care of her family and continue running her business. She has already received one loan from the field partner, ACFIME, which was repaid on the correct dates.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of wheatflour, 2 sacks of sugar and other ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 54 years old and from the community of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She and her husband work together so they can buy what they need. Their six children are already adults.

She is into growing vegetables like eggplant and raising hogs for a living. She needs additional capital to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and food that she can stock in her home.

Claudia has faith that her farming will turn out well and pave a way to her living a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and food that she can stock in her home.

loans.name: Monise

texts.fr: Monise, 34 ans, est divorcée. Elle a deux enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires à domicile. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle arrive à entrer un peu d’argent pour nourrir sa famille. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter du lait concentré et des boites de saumons.
texts.en:
Monise is thirty-four years old, divorced and has two children. She sells food products from her home. Thanks to this business she earns some money to feed her family.

Monise is requesting this loan to buy concentrated milk and cans of salmon.

loans.use: to buy concentrated milk and cans of salmon.

loans.name: Jesus Manuel

texts.es: Jesús es un hombre de 26 años de edad que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de auxiliar de albañil, oficio que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 4 años. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su tía  y su madre, con las que se apoya para salir adelante. Jesús es un hombre visionario que siempre busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que anteriormente solicito un crédito para construir una canaleta en su vivienda. Actualmente solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: alambre eléctrico, toma corriente, caja térmica, postes etc., para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jesus, 26, works as an assistant bricklayer for four years which has allowed him to provide for his family. He lives in his own house with his aunt and mother who all depend on each other to get ahead.

Jesus is a visionary who always looks for ways to improve his quality of life. So previously he requested a loan to build a cable conduit in his home. Now he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy electric wire, outlets, a thermal box, posts, etc. to install electricity in his home to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy electric wire, outlets, a thermal box, posts, etc. to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Venicia

texts.fr: Venicia, 44 ans, a sept enfants. Elle revend des haricots. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du centre-ville et revend son stock à domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des sacs de hariot.
texts.en:
Venicia is forty-four years old and has seven children. She sells beans from her home. She buys her stock from the market in the centre of town. .

Venicia is requesting this loan to buy more sacks of beans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans.

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr: Chantale revend des sucreries. C’est le seul moyen dont elle dispose pour nourrir ses six enfants. Elle veut améliorer sa situation financière en augmentant les revenus de l’activité. Avec ce crédit elle acheter davantage de stock en vue d’accroitre ses chiffres de vente.
texts.en:
Chantale sells sweets. This is the only way that she has of feeding her six children. She would like to improve her financial situation and increase the earnings from her business.

Chantale is requesting this loan to buy more stock and increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase her stock levels.

loans.name: Marie Monite

texts.fr: Monite est âgée de 45. Elle est divorcée. Elle vit avec ses deux enfants.  Elle revend des vêtements d’occasion. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie et arrive à prendre soin de ses enfants. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Monite is 45 years old.  She is divorced and lives with her two children.  She resells used clothing.  Thanks to this activity she makes a living and manages to take care of her children.  She is taking a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: La vivienda de Rosa es muy humilde y está hecha de láminas deterioradas y madera, y en ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una hija de 18 años y un varón de 14 años de edad. Ella tiene 56 años de edad y se gana la vida con su venta de chocolate artesanal, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, junto a su en su comunidad y los alrededores. Rosa siempre busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que anteriormente solicito un crédito con el cual encemento el piso de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas del techo y parte de las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa's is a very humble home made of deteriorated corrugated metal and wood. She lives there with her life partner and her two children, a daughter, 18, and a son, 14.

Rosa is 56 and earns a living selling artisan chocolate which she has been doing for two years in her community and nearby areas.

Rosa always looks for a way to improve her quality of life, so she used a previous loan to install a concrete floor in her house. Now she is requesting a new loan through FUSAI to buy corrugated metal, wood, nalls and wire to change the roof and some of the walls in her house.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal, wood, nails and wire to change the roof and some of the walls of her house.

loans.name: Syliana

texts.fr: Syliana est âgée de 50 ans. Elle a cinq enfants, mais ils sont tous déjà majeurs et vivent dans leurs propres foyers.  Syliana revend des produits alimentaires et boissons gazeuses à domicile. Cela lui permet de trouver un peu d’argent pour répondre à ses besoins au quotidien. Elle va utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des caisses de boissons gazeuses.
texts.en: Syliana is 50 years old.  She has five children who are all adults already and have founded their own families.  Syliana resells food products and carbonated drinks from home.  This activity allows her to make a little money to meet her daily needs.  She will use her loan to buy some crates of carbonated drinks.

loans.use: to buy crates of carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Keline

texts.fr: Keline revend des produit alimentaires divers à son domicile. La vente de produits alimentaires marche très bien dans sa localité et elle souhaite en profiter au maximum. Elle a demandé ce prêt en vue d’augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Keline resells various food products from home.  This type of activity works very well in her locality, so she is trying to take advantage of this good situation.  She is taking a loan in order to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products.

loans.name: Paula Valeria

texts.es:
Paula continúa con su negocio de venta de comida a la brasa. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando una parrilla para reponer la antigua, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funcionó correctamente. Actualmente su negocio mejoró, la parrilla nueva es amplia y puede cocinar más carne ampliando los horarios de atención, los nuevos clientes exigen refrescos fríos para acompañar la comida, su negocio no cuenta con refrigerador para refrescos, “seguimos trabajando duro junto a mi pareja, y con mucho esfuerzo para que el negocio salga adelante…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque no tiene competencia en este rubro en el lugar. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja junto a su pareja, la desventaja es la falta de un refrigerador para bebidas. Su sueño es tener su restaurante consolidado y muy conocido, ella desea comprar un refrigerador para gaseosas y un mostrador. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paula solicita un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y un mostrador de refrescos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula continues with her grilled meats business. She used the previous loan to buy a new grill to replace the old one. Her loan payments were made on time because the business went as expected. Now it has improved with the new grill and she can cook more meat and stay open longer. Her new customers are requesting cold drinks to go with the food but she has no refrigerator for the drinks, "My partner and I continue to work hard and through much effort the business is getting ahead..." she says.

Her business is successful because she has no local competition. The advantage is that she works with her partner and the disadvantage is the lack of a refrigerator for the drinks.

Her dream is to have a consolidated, well-known restaurant. She wants to buy a refrigerator for sodas and a counter. This is her second loan through the institution in the year she has been in business.

Paula is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and soda counter to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and soda counter to improve her business.

loans.name: Masela

texts.fr: Masela est commerçante. Elle vit avec son mari et leurs quatre enfants. Grace à son petit commerce de produits alimentaires, elle gagne un peu de revenus qui lui permettent d’aider son mari à couvrir les dépenses du foyer. Elle se débrouille quotidiennement pour offrir à sa famille des conditions de vie digne. Avec ce crédit, elle compte augmenter son stock de spaghetti et de sucre.
texts.en: Massera is a saleswoman. She lives with her husband and their four children. Thanks to her little business selling food products, she makes an income that enables her to help her husband to cover the household expenses. She takes care of things daily so that her family can live in decent conditions. With this loan, she plans to increase her stock of spaghetti and sugar.

loans.use: to increase her stock of spaghetti and sugar.

loans.name: Yplinna

texts.fr: Yplinna est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de cinq enfants. Elle fait le commerce de haricot en détail. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie depuis plusieurs années. Elle veut développer cette petite activité. Elle demande ce prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Yplinna is 54 years old.  She is a widow and the mother of five children.  She sells beans on a retail basis.  Thanks to her activity, she's been making a living for several years.  She would like to expand this small business.  She is taking a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beans.

loans.name: Irescia

texts.fr: Irescia, 52 ans, est mariée. Elle n’a pas d’enfants. Elle habite seule avec son mari. Elle tient une petite boutique à domicile. Elle y vend des produits cosmétiques et alimentaires. Cette activité lui procure les revenus nécessaires pour subvenir aux premiers besoins de la maison. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des déodorants, des dentifrices et des brosses à dents.
texts.en: Irescia is 52 years old and married.  She doesn't have any children and lives alone with her husband.  She runs a small shop at home. She sells cosmetics as well as food products.  Thanks to this activity, she makes enough money to meet her household's basic needs.  She is taking this loan to buy deodorants, toothpaste and toothbrushes.

loans.use: to buy deodorants, toothpaste and toothbrushes.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noé es un hombre emprendedor que se dedica a la elaboración de café, con lo cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, además cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia. Él a sus 41 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 10 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando. El negocio de venta de café le ha resultado muy prospero a Noé, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permite mejorar su negocio. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado comprará café en grano por mayoreo para su venta de café molido.
texts.en:
Noe is an entrepreneur who sells coffee to support his family. He also has a store and sells basic products to earn extra income.

He is 41 years old and lives with his life partner and ten-year-old son who attends school. The coffee sales business has been very prosperous for Noe, but he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to improve it even more. He will use the loan to buy coffee grains wholesale to sell ground coffee.

loans.use: to buy coffee grains wholesale to sell ground coffee to his many customers.

loans.name: Julia Gumercinda

texts.es: Julia a sus 53 años de edad siempre muestra su espíritu de emprendedurismo, por  lo que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de huevos y presta sus servicios en una tienda con lo cual sostiene a su familia. Ella habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de 16 años de edad, al que logra sostener como madre soltera. Julia siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, por lo que además de su venta de huevos, ella ha decidido invertir en la elaboración de café molido, con lo cual espera mejorar sus ingresos. Por lo anterior Julia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en huevos por mayoreo y granos de café para iniciar su venta de café molido.
texts.en:
Julia, 53, always has had an entrepreneurial spirit and for three years now she has been selling eggs and working at a store to support her family. She lives in her own house with her 16-year-old son who she supports since she is a single mother.

Julia is always looking for ways to get ahead so she sells eggs and has decided to sell ground coffee to earn extra income. Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy eggs wholesale and coffee beans to start selling ground coffee.

loans.use: to buy wholesale eggs and coffee beans to start selling ground coffee.

loans.name: Jean Martin

texts.fr: Jean Martin est âgé de 52 ans. Il est divorcé mais vit avec ses quatre enfants. Depuis cinq ans, il a mis sur pied une petite activité de revente d’articles utilisés dans la construction. Il revend de la peinture, des fils électrique, prises électrique, etc.  Grace à cette activité, il trouve de quoi bien prendre soin de son foyer. Il trouve aussi un peu d’argent pour déposer sur son compte d’épargne. Avec ce pret il va augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Jean Martin is 52 years old.  He is divorced and lives with his four children.  For the past five years he has been running a small shop and selling construction supplies such as paints, electric cords, batteries etc.  Thanks to this activity, he makes enough money to take good care of his family.  He is also able to put some money into his saving account.  This loan will help him to increase his stock.

loans.use: to increase his stock of construction supplies.

loans.name: Marie Bianca

texts.fr: Bianca est propriétaire d’une jolie boutique de produits cosmétiques. Sa boutique est bien garnie et très achalandée. Pour bien profiter des opportunités de vente de la fin d’année, elle sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Bianca the owner of a nice boutique of cosmetic products. Her shop is well stocked and very busy. To take full advantage of the increased sales over the end of the year period, she requests a micro credit to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Marie Michaelle

texts.fr: Michaelle a 39 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a trois enfants. Elle a une petite épicerie chez elle. Elle a beaucoup de clients dans les environs. Elle a déjà obtenu plusieurs microcrédits qui ont contribué dans le développement de l’activité. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficulté. Pour ce présent prêt, elle compte acheter des caisses de boissons énergisantes et des caisses de jus en bouteille.
texts.en: Michelle is 39. She lives with her partner and she has three children. She runs a small grocery shop from her home. She has many local customers. She has already received several micro credits that have contributed to the development of the business. She has always repaid the loan without difficulty. For this loan, she plans to buy crates of energizing drinks and crates of bottled juice.

loans.use: to buy crates of energizing drinks  and crates of juice in bottles.

loans.name: Nejoniheza Group

texts.fr:
François  fait partie du groupe Nejoniheza   et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a  27 ans et est marié  à Irène, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 6 ans.Il a sous sa charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de pommes de terre et de bananes  depuis  15 ans. 

Il est à  son  quatrième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de pommes de terre  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter une moto.
texts.en:
François is a member of the Nejoniheza group and he lives in Bujumbura.  He is 27 years old and married to Irene, a retailer.  Together, they have three children between the ages of 2 and 6.  He also takes care of some relatives' child.  That particular child is a student.

François has been selling potatoes and bananas for the past 15 years.

This is his fourth loan with Turame.  With this current loan, financed by Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale.  His goal is to increase his income.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Toktoaiym

texts.ru: Токтоайым, 51 год, вдова, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2014 года занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 15 овец и 4 лошади. Корма для скота заготавливают сами. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи, поэтому Токтоайым обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Она состоит в группе "Куз", всего в группе - 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она вложит в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Toktoaiym is 51, widowed, and a mother of two. She has a high school education and has been farming since 2014. She has 4 cows, 15 sheep, and 4 horses and grows feed for the animals herself. Her business earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month, but this is not enough to earn a living, so she applied for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She is a member of the "Kuz" group, which consists of three people. She will invest the earnings from the loan in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: María Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas de 18 y 21 años de edad,  vive con sus hijas en la comunidad 2 de Julio en el Municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara que colinda con el sector de Cofradía Cortes.
Doña María se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de comida (pollo frito, chuleta frita, refrescos, helados y churros), dedicando 11 horas diarias de trabajo contínuo. Con su propio esfuerzo y la ayuda financiera a través de préstamos, inicio su negocio de venta de comida con el objetivo de obtener un mejoramiento económico familiar. En la actualidad ha solicitado un crédito más a la institución por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de insumos como carnes, verduras, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, harina de maíz y otros para la elaboración de comidas, además compra de refrescos para vender. Su meta a futuro es comprar un terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She is a single mother of two daughters aged 18 and 21. She lives with her daughters in the "2 de julio" community in the Petoa municipality, Santa Barbara, bordering the Cofradía Cortes sector.

For several years, María has made a living selling food (fried chicken, fried cutlet, soft drinks, ice cream, and churros), devoting 11 hours a day of continuous work. Through her own effort and the financial support through loans, she started her food sales business in order to obtain an economic family improvement. At present, she has requested one more loan to the institution in the amount of 25,000 lempiras, which plans to invest in the purchase of inputs such as meats, vegetables, spices, rice, beans, cornmeal, and others to prepare meals, plus the purchase of soft drinks to sell.

María's future goal is to buy a plot of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as meats, vegetables, spices, rice, beans, cornmeal, and others to prepare meals, plus the purchase of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es: Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA”. Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Una de ellas es la Sra. Maruja de 61 años de edad divorciada. La Sra. Maruja es muy trabajadora y emprendedora que a base  de su esfuerzo ha sabido superarse y sacar a su familia adelante. La Sra.  Maruja trabaja ya hace 7 años en su pequeño negocio de salón de belleza en su propio domicilio. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá para comprar más accesorios de salón de belleza (tijeras, peines, etc.) La Sra. Maruja es la segunda persona de la mano derecha se le distingue por llevar una casaca de color plomo. A la vez  la Sra. Maruja y todas las integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidas   con Kiva  y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado y se  despiden  dejando la promesa  que cumplirán todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: This is how the members of the communal group Dios es Amor y Mi Guia are, a group made up of 5 enterprising women with a lot of creativity for business. One of them is Maruja, 61 years old and divorced. Maruja is very hard-working and enterprising and, based on her efforts, has improved herself and gotten her family ahead. Maruja has worked for 7 years now at her small beauty salon business in her own home. With the granted loan, she will invest it in the purchase of more beauty salon accessories (scissors, combs, etc.). Maruja is the second person from the right who is distinguished by wearing a grey jacket. Maruja and all the group members are also grateful Kiva and Edaprospo for the granted loan and for the confidence that has been offered to them and they leave with the promise that they will achieve all their established goals.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon accessories (scissors, combs, etc.).

loans.name: Sarbelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Sarbelio, es casado, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo que tiene 10 años de edad, que estudia en la escuela de su comunidad y depende económicamente de él, Sarbelio se dedica a la venta de ropa oficio que aprendió hace 8 años y desde hace 5 años decidió poner su propio negocio, el cual le está funcionando muy bien, él sale a vender la ropa cuatro días a la semana y el quinto día se dedica a comprar más mercadería para poderla comercializar.
Él solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de mercadería como lo son blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, etc., para aprovechar la temporada navideña y las fiestas patronales de su domicilio, ya que considera que de esa manera podrá generar mejores ingresos y así brindara en gran manera mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El sueño de Sarbelio es poder comprar y vender ropa al por mayor y poder surtir a distintos mercados de la región oriental del país, además poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Sarbelio is married and lives with his wife and they have a son who is 10 years old, who studies at the community school and depends on him economically. Sarbelio works selling clothing, a trade he learned 8 years ago and 5 years ago he decided to establish his own business, which is going very well for him. He goes out to sell the clothing four days per week and on the fifth day he works purchasing more merchandise to sell.

He asks for a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of merchandise such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, lingerie, etc. to take advantage of the Christmas season and the patron saint festivals of his home, since he believes that in this way he will be able to generate more income and, so, to offer a better quality of life, in a great way, for his family.

Sarbelio's dream is to be able to buy and sell clothing in bulk and be able to stock various markets in the eastern region of the country, in addition to being able to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, lingerie, etc. to take advantage of the Christmas season and the patron saint festivals of his home.

loans.name: Mujeres Bendesidas Group

texts.es: Blanca, de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus 3 hijos en una de las comunidades del municipio de Yoro. Ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de Granos básicos como ser frijoles, maíz y carne de cerdo. Ella cría y engorda cerdos para vender la carne. Ha sido muy emprendedora, ha invertido varios prestamos en el negocio para sostenerlo activo. Actualmente solicita otro en forma grupal para comprar maíz y frijoles para reventa, además de que vende carne de cerdo, con esto va aprovechar la temporada de fin de año para aumentar las ventas. Su meta es mejorar su casa, brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos y fortalecer su negocio. El grupo se llama Mujeres Bendesidas, formado por 4 miembros, quienes se dedican a vender granos básicos. Todos viven en la misma comunidad y solicitan la cantidad de 29,000 Lempiras para invertir en sus negocios. En la fotografía se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda con abrigo rojo está Dina, luego Blanca, sigue Caren y al lado derecho Marta.
texts.en: Blanca, 39 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 3 children in one of the communities of the municipality of Yoro. she has worked for 15 years selling basic grains such as beans, corn, and pork. She raises and fattens pigs to sell the meat. She has been very enterprising and has invested various loans in the business to keep it alive. Currently, she asks for another as part of a group loan to purchase corn and beans to resell, in addition to selling pork, with this she will take advantage of the end of the year season to increase her sales. Her goal is to improve her house, offer her children a better education, and strengthen her business. The group called Mujeres Bendesidas is made up of 4 members who work selling basic grains. They all live in the same community and are identified as follows: on the left with a red jacket is Dina, then Blanca, followed by Caren and on the right side is Marta.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beans to stock her business and sell.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas y elaboración de queso, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijas de 17 y 11 años de edad, a las que logra sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Mirian ha decidido invertir en su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, por mayor para su venta de tortillas y su negocio de elaboración y venta de queso para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mirian is a hardworking woman who has been selling tortillas and making cheese for three years; this helps her to sustain her family.

She is 49 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her two daughters aged 17 and 11, and manages to raise them thanks to her persistence.

Mirian has decided to invest in her business. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn in bulk for her tortillas and cheese making business, and in that way improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk for her tortillas and cheese-making business, and improve her profits.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is married man from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He is 37 years old and lives with his wife, who is a private nurse and gets a fixed income.

It's already been seven years that Davit has worked at a private metal shop as an artisan, where he gets some income. Davit has great and long experience of this kind of work, and thus he decided to lead the same business on his own.

The startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,500 GEL.

Davit will produce metal doors, gratings, banisters and other things with private orders. He is a good artisan who has his own loyal costumers and will lead the business properly.

Davit and his wife await your financial support to make their own business and get more income.

loans.use: to have his own metal shop and get orders.

loans.name: Falinirina

texts.fr:
Falinirina est une jeune paysanne de 24 ans. Elle vit à la campagne avec son mari est ses 2 enfants. Elle cultive la terre et exerce toute sorte d’élevage. 
Cela fait 2 ans qu’elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Les bénéfices des prêts précédents lui ont permis d’acheter un terrain productif. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter une vache laitière. En effet, le marché du lait est encore vaste. 
Son objectif est d’être autonome financièrement et donc de ne plus prendre de prêts à l’avenir
texts.en:
Falinirina is a 24-year-old farmer. She lives with her husband and their two children. She works the land and raises many different varieties of livestock.

She has been borrowing from Vahatra for two years. The profits from the previous loans have allowed her to purchase a plot of land for growing crops. This loan will allow her to purchase a dairy cow. There is a high demand for milk in her area.

Her goal is to become financially independent, so she will not have to take out any further loans in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celio Antonio

texts.es:
Celio está contento por mantener su negocio funcionando y generando los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia, el préstamo anterior le fue de apoyo para realizar la siembra de granos básicos en el tiempo justo. Hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún tipo de problemas para realizar sus actividades.
Para mantener la continuidad de su negocio, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, pues así aumentara su inventario y aprovechara el zacate de proveniente de sus cultivos, de esta manera seguirá contando con una fuente de ingresos estables.
texts.en:
Celio feels happy because his business is running and generating the income he needs to get ahead with his family. The previous loan helped him to sow staple grains just in time. As of yet, he has not had any kind of problem to do his work.

In order to continue with his business, he is requesting a new loan to buy cattle, have more animals, and make use of the grass that grows in his land. This means that he will continue relying on a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy cattle, have more animals, and make use of the grass that grows in his land.

loans.name: Rey Jomar

texts.en:
Rey Jomar is a carpenter. He is a married man and has a 9-month-old baby boy.

Aside from doing carpentry, Rey Jomar and his wife run a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living. They work hard together to provide the needs of their son.

He is asking for a loan to buy stocks for their sari-sari store such as liquor, soft drinks, snacks foods, canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, spices and toiletries. They will also buy coconut wine known as “tuba” to sell.

Rey Jomar wishes to improve his livelihood for his son and their future children. The family lives a simply in Calape, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy liquor, soft drinks, snacks foods, canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, spices, toiletries and coconut wine known as “tuba.”

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro se mantiene trabajando en el campo, actualmente tiene cultivos con un buen desarrollo, él está solicitando un nuevo crédito para pagar obreros que le ayudarán a recolectar la cosecha, espera tener todo listo en menor tiempo y mantener a sus clientes satisfecho.
El préstamo anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio y realizar sus actividades agrícolas de la temporada, de esta manera puede sostener su hogar, a pesar de que su negocio es de subsistencia las condiciones de vida familiar son un poco mejores. No ha enfrentado problemas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro continues working in the field. His crops are growing well.

He is requesting a new loan to pay workers to help him gather the harvest. He hopes to have everything ready as soon as possible, and satisfy his customers' demands.

With the previous loan he was able to strengthen his business and perform the seasonal activities; this is how he sustains his home. Although his is a subsistence business, his family's living conditions have improved. He has not faced major difficulties.

loans.use: to pay workers to help him gather the harvest. He hopes to have everything ready as soon as possible and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Santoshi Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2015 at Charpali village of Nuapada district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active self-dependent women with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the group have their own professions and businesses.

Pushpanjali is one who taken a great role for her development and their group members' source of revenue improvement. She is seated third from the left with raised hand in the photo.

She is about 30 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and one son.

Pushpanjali has been engaged in vegetable vending for the last 10 years. Her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through the business, the family earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR.

In Pushpanjali’s opinion, with this small income it is very difficult to maintain the family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business.

Pushpanjali plans to purchase tomato, corley flower, chili, potatoes, onion, garlic, zinger, cucumber, reddish, carrot, capsicum, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to provide better education to her son.

The other 10 members of her group are also smart at their professions and are actively engaged in various businesses like dairy, tea & tiffin stall, grocery shop, betel shop, fancy and cosmetic shop, etc. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase tomato, corley flower, chili, potatoes, onion, garlic, zinger, cucumber, reddish, carrot, capsicum, etc.

loans.name: Budai's Group

texts.en:
Budai is a simple and down-to-earth person standing to the left in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. A married lady with two school-going sons in her care, she does not have access to toilet in her house. She goes outside to an open field to attend nature's call at odd hours. She faces a lot of difficulties when there is heavy rain and thunderstorms, and she feels that she is vulnerable to crimes and has a chance of getting affected by infectious communicable diseases.

Therefore, Budai, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and attach requisite sanitary fittings to it.

The loan amount will ultimately result her in restoring her privacy and increasing her safety and hygiene. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and attach requisite sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: Damuni's Group

texts.en:
Damuni is the lady standing to the left in the photograph. She and her family suffer from the rural sanitation crisis that persists in India.

She is married to a butcher and has a family of four in a interior village of Koraput district, India.

Unavailability of a toilet compels her and her family to walk a long distance in order to defecate in between the dense bushes. She feels that this unsanitary practice some day will cause her to suffer from serious infection caused by open defecation.

Therefore, Damuni, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet with basic sanitary amenities attached to it.

Damuni is in dire need of your kind help and support and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a toilet with basic sanitary amenities attached to it.

loans.name: Rolando Alfredo
