texts.es: Rolando es un hombre de 24 años de edad, que cuenta con una venta de comida rápida, desde hace 1 año, la cual cuenta con una gran clientela, por lo que se siente muy feliz. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hermano de 18 años de edad al que apoya mucho. Rolando desea incrementar sus ventas y cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan. Por lo anterior Rolando solicita a FUSAI un crédito con el cual invertirá en materia prima para elaborar los productos que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Rolando is a 24-year-old man who has been selling fast food for a year. He has many customers, something that makes him feel happy.

He owns the house where he lives with his 18-year-old brother. He helps him a lot.

Rolando wants to increase his sales and deliver his customers' orders. This is why Rolando is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy ingredients to make the products his customers' demand.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients to make the products his customers demand.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is maize farmer from Kargi Toka village. As a member of Babban Gona, Joshua is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Joshua is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Celia Margarita

texts.es:
Celia es casada, tiene un hijo que estudia primaria, tiene como negocio atender un salón de belleza, comenta que desde hace aproximadamente cinco años inicio a trabajar como empleada de un salón de belleza, ya con mucha experiencia a partir del año 2015 se independizo y fundo su propio negocio.
Para salir adelante con su familia y mejorar su negocio, está solicitando un crédito en Padecomsm con el que comprara tintes, cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos para el cabello, etc., tendrá más oportunidad de satisfacer a sus clientes y generar nuevos ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para ser un apoyo económico fijo para su esposo.
texts.en:
Celia is married. She has a son who goes to primary school. She has a beauty salon, and says that she started to work approximately five years ago as an employee. After gaining experience, she opened her own salon in 2015.

To get ahead with her family and improve her business, she is applying for a loan from PADECOMSM. She will use it to buy dyes, cosmetics, creams, hair treatments, etc. She will be able to satisfy her customers' needs and generate more income to fulfill her commitments.

Her dream is to continue working and supporting her husband economically.

loans.use: to buy dyes, cosmetics, creams, hair treatments, etc. She will be able to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica tiene como negocio cultivar granos básicos y venta de cocos, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres cuando ella era una niña, vive con su grupo familiar compuesto por su compañero de vida y tres hijos que tienen las edades de 11, 6 y 2 años.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar básicos,  asimismo pagara mozos para desarrollar los trabajos agrícola de la temporada, considera que de esta manera su negocio mejorara y obtendrá más granos, el riesgo en este negocio es que se ve amenazado por las plagas.
Sus sueños son resarcir su deuda con buen record crediticio, ampliar el área de cultivo y dar a su familia un futuro más prometedor.
texts.en:
Angélica is in the business of cultivating basic grains and selling coconuts. She learned this trade from her parents when she was a very young girl. She lives with her family made up of her life partner and three children who are 11, 6, and 2 years old.

She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as basic grains. She will also pay workers to carry out the seasonal agricultural work. By doing this she thinks that her business will improve and she will obtain more grains. The risk in this business is the threat of pests.

Her dreams are are to repay her debt with a good credit record, to expand the area under cultivation, and to give her family a more promising future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to plant basic grains, also to pay workers to carry out the seasonal agricultural work, as she believes this is the way to improve her business

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ezekiel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ezekiel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ezekiel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yaú

texts.en:
Yaú is maize farmer from Dantani village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yaú is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yaú would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yaú can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Yaú is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un joven soltero de 24 años de edad, desde que falleció su padre ayuda  a su mamá con los gastos del hogar. Esta estudiando y le falta poco para graduarse, también trabaja de tiempo completo como analista de nomina.
El joven padece de miopía y astigmatismo por predisposición genética, para mejorar su agudeza visual usa lentes graduados. Durante una revisión periódica el especialista observo un  desgarre en la retina y desde hace mas de dos años no ha cambiado sus gafas.
Necesita una cirugía urgente  para evitar el desprendimiento de la retina, ya que de suceder esto puede quedar ciego.
texts.en:
He is 24 years old and single. Ever since his father died he helps his mother with the household expenses. He is going to school, and he is close to graduating. He also works full time as a payroll analyst.

He suffers from myopia and astigmatism due to a genetic predisposition. In order to improve his visual acuity, he uses graduated lenses. During a periodic exam the specialist noticed a tear in the retina. He has not changed his glasses in over two years.

He urgently needs surgery to avoid detachment of the retina. If this happens, he would be left blind.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is asking for a loan of $250 to buy food and clothing. He is a maize farmer from the village of Shararriya in Nigeria. As a Babban Gona member, Abdu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs. These will give him the chance to achieve a high yield of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdu had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash need for food and clothing. However, as a Babban Gona member, Abdu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season. In this way, he can obtain the best price for his maize and sell it at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abdu hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Armayau

texts.en:
Armayau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Armayau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Armayau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Armayau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Armayau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Armayau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un joven casado de 31 años de edad,  tiene dos hijas una de ocho años y la mas pequeña de tres años.Trabaja actualmente como auxiliar administrativo.
Desafortunadamente en una revisión que se realizó,  le encontraron un error orgánico en su ojo derecho,  él desde hace tiempo notaba que tenía dificultad para ver, lo hacía por un sólo ojo, sin embargo nunca se atendió.
Este padecimiento ha empezado afectar su trabajo, por lo que acudió con un especialista quien le confirmo que tiene miopía en su ojo derecho  y que posiblemente esto sea hereditario.
El tratamiento quirúrgico le resulta muy  costoso ya que sus ingresos son limitados y él es el único sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
He is 31 years old and married. He has two daughters. One is eight years old, and the littler one is three years old. He currently works as an assistant administrator.

Unfortunately, during an exam he had they found an organic problem in his right eye. For some time he noticed that it was difficult for him to see, and he did so with just one eye. Nevertheless, he never had it taken care of. This condition has started to affect his work. That is why he turned to a specialist, who confirmed that he has myopia in his right eye. This is possibly hereditary.

The surgical treatment is very expensive. His income is limited, and he is the sole support of his family.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Jacquelinne Del Carmen

texts.es: Jacqueline es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de piñatas y platos típicos, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus platos típicos tiene un sabor muy delicioso, además con su elaboración de piñatas logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Jacqueline desea invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus platos típicos, además de las piñatas. Por lo anterior Jacqueline ha solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de materia prima para sus platos típicos y sus piñatas, y de esta manera cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 29, is a hardworking woman who works selling piñatas and traditional foods. This allows her to get her family ahead, since her foods have a delicious flavor, and the making of piñatas brings in more income, improving her earnings.

She wants to invest in the supplies needed to prepare her traditional foods as well as the piñatas, and is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI. She will in this way be able to fill the orders from her customers,

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare her traditional foods and piñatas, so that she can fill her customer orders.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet is a 35-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Linet has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Linet described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Linet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali makes pickled vegetables. Now her business has grown so much she needed to rent out a ‎storage place for her products. She sells the pickled items to various stores in the area.‎

Ali needs this loan for materials, containers and initial storage rental.‎

She is working to grow her business and gain long term contracts with a local chain of stores.‎

loans.use: to buy materials and containers and to rent initial storage.

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en:
Abdulkadir is asking for a loan of $200 to buy food and clothing. This Kiva loan will be used to provide Abdulkadir with cash to pay for his food and clothing until he receives income from the harvest.

He is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member in Nigeria. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdulkadir has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulkadir had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. However, thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkadir can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdulkadir will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Abdulkadir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a maize farmer from Shararriya village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Abdu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Abdu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha is a 26 years old single lady who lives with her family in Jarash. She wanted to be a productive lady in the family and the society so she went and learned how to sew. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine to start her own business at home and used what she learned to tailor clothes and do clothes repairing too, to make her own income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her own business at home

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her mid 40's is married with four children. She has been running a cosmetics shop for 14 years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy some new updated cosmetics and restocked her shop to meet customers demand. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now proceeding well. 
She used her profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, reinvest in business and pay school fees. 

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items at her cosmetics store. She dreams of expanding her business into a whole selling store.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group WAKORINTHO, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items at her cosmetics store.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 39years old, married with 4 children living in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  Marlon owns and operates a transportation transport service for many years to earn a living and to support the family's daily needs. Recently, he took a new loan to buy tires and repair his  motorcycle to commute to other village and towns. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase tires for repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes and has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big shoe stall. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is 46 years old and married with five children.  

Mariafe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mariafe requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mariafe has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mariafe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man, who lives with his family in Mafraq.

Currently, Mohammad is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Education, so as to become a teacher, at a university located in the north of Jordan.

Due to the fact that he is short of finances to cover his university fees from the first to the third year, he would like to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for a BA in Education, so as to become a teacher

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Hellen will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Hellen plans to use the profits she earns this year to send her children to school.

In total Hellen’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Gleiner

texts.en:
Gleiner is 25 years old and married, and he has a young daughter. He and his family live in his own house in the rural sector of the province of Esmeraldas in Ecuador.

Gleiner finished high school but couldn't go to college because he had to look after his mother and two younger brothers. He recently finished building his house. His wife works part-time as a cleaning woman at a local hotel.

Gleiner is a fisherman who goes fishing twice a week. He leaves on Monday, very early in the morning, and comes back on Wednesday. Then he leaves on Friday and comes back on Sunday. Sometimes he doesn't have enough money to go on board and he has had to cancel his fishing trips.

He wants this loan to buy fishhooks and plastic bags. Gleiner will apreciate your support.

loans.use: to buy fishhooks and plastic bags for his fishing business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Hilda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of vegetable to sell.

Hilda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Gemma has a buy and sell purified drinking water business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Muath

texts.en:
Moath is 21-year-old, Jordanian man and student in university, majoring in English language. He lives with his parents in a sector in Jordan called Salt. He is very tender and cares a lot about all of his family members.

Today, he is eager to take a loan from Kiva to pay his university educational fees. He said that he is very happy with the loan that will allow him to pursue his education.

loans.use: to pay his university educational fees for a BA in English Language

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman, 44 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alma has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 60 years old and married with six children. Leonida works very hard to provide for them.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, and other groceries.

Leonida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Leonida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Sovann is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 29 years old. She lives in a wooden house with one floor with her husband, her 4 years old son and her sister, who is studying in high school. Her family owns 6 hectares of rice fields and 2,5 hectares of cassava fields.

In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Sovann makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is 40 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for 10 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Roselyne is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Roselyne started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2012 and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she likes being a leader.

Roselyne’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing solar lights so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 23 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her 2 parents and her young brother. She just came back because she divorced from her husband after 3 years of wedding. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field.

In 2015, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sophy makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe.

She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Roseline's Group

texts.en:
Roseline is 56 years old and has 10 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Roseline is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Roseline started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Roseline’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 41-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Emily has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Emily described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Emily’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Litchenza Group

texts.en:
Vanessa is 28 years old and divorced. She has 2 children and 4 relatives that depend on her.

Vanessa owns a grocery business. She has requested for this loan to buy a refrigerator which she will use for cooling soft drinks which are sold in her store. The business helps her to feed, clothe and pay school fees for her children. She started her business with the aim of becoming financially independent so she can access her basic needs. 2 of her family members helps with the daily activities of the business.

Her goal is to own a self contained house and to own a big grocery store with a wider variety of items.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her grocery store

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan, pictured above, has been a farmer for five years and is now proud to represent her group of seven farmers in Webuye District. She is 32 years old, married, and has eight children.

Joan likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2015 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Joan plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Joan’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate four acres of land. Some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights with this loan for a group total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvest of maize.

loans.name: Noshaba

texts.en: Noshaba  is 44 years old, married woman; shown in the photo with her son. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Noshaba  has requested for a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Nancy, who, as a group leader, is representing 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is a mother to five children and is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Nancy joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from her farm training. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Nancy plans to buy a goat.

Between the 12 farmers in Nancy's Group, a total of 9.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en:
Hiram is an outgoing middle aged businessman who runs a boutique business in Nairobi's Embakasi area. He is a father of three children and depends on his business ventures to provide for their needs. Recently, he build over twenty rental units in Mukuru Kwa Njenga. Due to the lack of enough space and unavailable sewer lines in the area, he does not have any in built toilet facilities for his prospective tenants.

Learning about the Fresh Life Toilets option, introduced to him by Peter, one of Fresh Life operators in the area came in handy as a solution for Hiram.

He has therefore resolved to provide an accessible, hygienic and dignified sanitary option for his tenants through installation of three Fresh Life Toilets at the plots.

loans.use: to pay for three Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma is a businesswoman in Dipolog City. She is known for her rice production, palay buying and rice trading business. She also owns and operates a rice milling business. She is making good proceeds through this type of business. Lerma said that everything was made possible because of the supports that Paglaum MPC had extended to her. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is engaged in running a fruits and vegetables stall. She has been operating her business for 15 years and earns a monthly net income of 8,000.00 PHP. Epifania is 63 years old, a widow and has 4 adult-aged children. She is from Dipolog City. In 2014, Epifania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes.

Epifania is requesting her 3rd loan of 5,000.00 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is 58 years old, a widow with 3 adult age children from Dipolog City. She has beenin the fruits and vegetables retailing business for twenty years. This gave her the opportunity to send all her children to school.

Recently, she took a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables for reselling.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables for reselling.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 59 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married with six adult age children. Lorna has a rice production business and owns a parcel of rice field and earns an approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000.00 PHP to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia makes good earnings with her farming activities in Mahayag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially given that she has a high cost of living since her children entered college.

Virginia approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Mahayag. She and her husband have some rice land and earn a living doing farming activities.

Recently, Carmen requested a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings and she hopes will yield more harvest.

Carmen deeply wishes to save enough for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. He tried his luck in doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital.

Wilfredo is borrowing another amount to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will help give his farming income a big boost.

Wilfredo looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Pedro Sixto

texts.en:
Pedro Sixto lives in San Miguel Buenavista, Tlacoapa, with his family. His town is located in Guerrero, one of the states with higher poverty rates in Mexico. Like most of the people of his town, his household lacks electricity; they depend on candles during the nights although this source of light is expensive, inefficient, and toxic because of the smoke.

He is a farmer who farms corn during the day. With the money he earns, Pedro Sixto has to support a whole family, but sometimes it is not enough to cover the basic needs and to save for incidentals. His wife takes care of his kids, and she always tries to help them with homework during the day. If they take longer, the candle lighting makes it difficult to see the notebooks causing them to complain that their eyes hurt.

Pedro Sixto wants to buy a solar system which will enable his family to do activities at night that are not harmful to their health. This will allow him to save $80 pesos (MXN) per month.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system that will allow him to take care of the health of his family and save money for incidentals.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up her rice production business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Renalyn was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good harvests these days.

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven casada de 25 años de edad, esta en espera de su primer hijo sin embargo su embarazo fue diagnosticado de alto riesgo ya que presenta placenta previa, por lo que sufre de hemorragias importantes, el especialista recomendó reposo absoluto, debido a esto tuvo que dejar de laborar. Su esposo trabaja como analista en una institución bancaria y ahora sus recursos son insuficientes para costear una cesárea y así evitar riesgos al bebe y a la futura madre durante el parto.
texts.en: This young borrower is married and is 25 years old.  She is expecting her first child.  However, her pregnancy has been diagnosed as high risk, because she has placenta previa.  As a result, she could suffer from significant hemorrhages.  Her doctor has recommended complete bedrest, and as a result she had to stop working.  Her husband works as an analyst for a banking institution, but now their resources are not sufficient to pay for a cesarean to avoid risks to the baby and the future mother during childbirth.

loans.use: to pay for a cesarean section

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano is 65 years old, married with 5 children of adult age and lives in Dipolog City. His wish is to send his children to school until they finish college and landed a good job. He doesn't want to see his children doing back breaking work in tilling and cultivating land as he's doing to provide their needs. Sinforiano is a hardworking farmer and a loving father to his children. Sinforiano recalls that everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like him.

To head start for the next cropping season, he avails a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase a good variety of seedlings.

loans.name: Gerwin

texts.en: Gerwin wants to fulfill his dreams by completing a degree. He religiously pays attention to making good marks in every semester he enters. For another school year, Gerwin is in need of an amount to pay for his school fees. Gerwin has big dreams of helping his family and his siblings as well, which is the reason why he works hard for his education.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has always had the enthusiasm for farming. She cultivates her land in Calamba and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the corn field is ready for planting. Elizabeth knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Bonafe

texts.en:
Bonafe is responsible and dedicated in her work as a farmer. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing rice grains for human consumptions. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

Bonafe applied for a loan in order to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will allow her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda is 52 years old, married, and is a resident of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Since Emmalinda wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. Last May 14, 2008 both Emmalinda and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to access a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

Emmalinda has now applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience & diligence from her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning another stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un señor casado de 56 años de edad, trabaja como empleado desde hace treinta y cuatro años en una fabrica farmacéutica.
Sufre de cataratas en ambos ojos desde hace  mas de dos años, ha estado en una larga espera para la cirugía por medio de seguridad social. Se encuentra desesperado porque pasa el tiempo y él sigue peor, para el cada día es mas difícil  salir y transportarse de su casa al trabajo y del trabajo a su casa, ya que corre el riesgo de sufrir algún accidente.
texts.en: This is a married, 56 year-old man who has worked as an employee in a pharmaceutical factory for 34 years.  He has been suffering from cataracts in both eyes for more than 2 years.  He has been waiting a long time to get the surgery through social security.  But he is getting desperate because over time he keeps getting worse.  Every day it is harder for him to go out and drive back and forth from his house to his work and he is running the risk of getting into an accident.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is a farmer and a mother living in the remote community of San Miguel Buenavista in Tlacoapa, Guerrero. As a farmer, she plants corn and beans from sunrise to sunset. She works all day to earn money for her family, is a single mother, and the head of her family. As a mother, she takes care of her kids after sunset when she arrives home, cooking dinner and also helping her kids with their homework. However, like many others in her town, her household lacks electricity, and the only lighting sources that Eusebia uses are candles and ocotea.

Eusebia knows that ocotea and candles are very dangerous for their health; they create smoke that is harmful for the respiratory system. When her kids try to do homework, the lack of illumination hurts their eyes. With a solar panel system, she will be able to save $90 pesos (MXN) per month, money that could used to provide her family with more food or clothes. This is why she wants to buy a solar system to protect her family; she is responsible for her kids and she wants them to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to protect her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora casada de 40 años de edad, se encuentra preocupada por la salud de su madre quien padece de una enfermedad crónica y que además hace tiempo sufrió un infarto, esto le ha traído consecuencias con su vista, su ojo izquierdo presenta problemas en LA retina, así como cataratas. Debido a lo anterior necesita urgentemente una operación para poder recuperar su vista. Sin embargo no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para solventar el gasto de la cirugía.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who is 40 years old.  She is worried about her mother's health.  Her mother suffers from a chronic illness, and also had a heart attack some time ago which has had consequences for her vision.  She has problems with the retina in her left eye, and she also suffers from cataracts.  

Due to these problems, she urgently needs an operation to recover her sight.  However, she lacks the resources needed to pay for the costs of the surgery.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Guadalupe Elizabeth

texts.es: Guadalupe de 34 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda par la construccion de un cuarto de madera pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de madera, clavos, laminas y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Guadalupe, 34, lives in a relative's house with her husband and their 2 children.  She's had a business making and selling tortillas for 3 years, and thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead.  She wants to improve her house by adding a room made of wood, but she lacks the resources to pay for this.  She is requesting a loan to buy wood, nails, and sheets of corrugated metal roofing material, and also to pay for labor.  This way she will have a more secure home.

loans.use: to pay for a room addition

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is married with three children of adult age and lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. His wish was to send his children to school until they finished college and landed a good job. He didn't want to see his children doing back breaking work in tilling and cultivating land like what he was doing to provide for their needs. Danilo is a hardworking farmer and a loving father to his children. He is a barangay official and has served his barangay with due honesty.

At this time, Danilo has seen that his hard work has paid off as he sees his children finished college. As he recalls, everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like him. To head start the next cropping season, he is availing himself of a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and the purchase of a good variety of seedlings for more produce that is healthier and heavier.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and the purchase of a good variety of seedlings for more produce that is healthier and heavier.

loans.name: Victor Orlando

texts.es: Víctor tiene 30 años de edad y se dedica a la fabricación de piñatas, gracias a este negocio ella logra sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 3 años, por lo que cuenta con clientes que solicitan sus productos por mayoreo. Él habita junto a su hijo de 15 años de edad, al que logra sacar adelante como un hombre soltero, lo que demuestra su responsabilidad. Víctor desea incrementar su negocio de elaboración de piñatas, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de piñatas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is 30 years old and makes piñatas for a living. Thanks to this business for the past three years, he has been able to raise his family. His customers request to purchase his products wholesale.

He lives with his 15 year old son, who manages to get ahead as a single man, proving his responsibility. Victor wants to increase his business making piñatas, as he has many customers demanding his products, so he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in materials for the production of piñatas and to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy material to make piñatas and increase his income.

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can access financial assistance for her chosen business.

Genita has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Genita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & vitamins.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
In 2008, Alicia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Alicia tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Alicia was loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Alicia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene has been a rice grower for twenty five years. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earn as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. In the future, Rebecca wishes to become the supplier of rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en: Emmalyn is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 36 years old, married and lives in Dipolog City. She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives her quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000.00 that sufficiently provides the needs of her family. Recently, she avails another loan to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Shiena

texts.en: Shiena has always dreamed of opening her own store to support her three children. She used this  loan to purchase additional stocks for her home products business. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her home products business.

loans.name: Leoncio Jr.

texts.en: Leoncio Jr. is a determined man who will do anything for his family. He is 32 years old, married and lives in Calamba. He operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC.  This business gives him a quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000 and sufficiently provides for the needs of his family.  Recently, he accessed another loan to buy more piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy piglets & feed.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 5 years. She and her husband has been tilling their own land for farming activity that primarily provides the needs of her family. Cirila found out that their income in farming is insufficient for the family needs especially on times when their eldest child enters college. As a hardworking farmer, she had also nurtures and work hard to repay her loans from the cooperative.

One time, she decided to expand her farm and ask for financial support from Paglaum MPC. Cirila is grateful of the trust the co-op had extended to her and able to buy the neighboring parcel of land. She successfully repaid the loan and this cropping season, she ask for another loan to augment her production. The amount of PHP 7,000.00 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides. Cirila is hopeful that she can have good harvest this season so that she can repay ahead of schedule her loan with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza makes good earning on her farming activities in Dipolog City. This is how she supports her family and able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially that she has high cost of living when her children entered college. Eliza approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 46 years old. He is married to Jane who is a dairy farmer, and they are blessed with three children aged 17 years, 15 years and Mary 13 years old. 

He has had a farming business for 15 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 35,000. He has borrowed KES. 40,000 from Visionfund Kenya, as his fourth loan after successful paying the previous loan. 

And he will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs. Therefore he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his children, cater for medical care, expanding his current business and clothes selling as his secondary business, also repay his loan too. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is managing her eatery business in Calamba. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of her family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income.

Recently, Jennifer was loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to buy meat for her restaurant.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking mother from Calamba. She is 35 years old and is a businesswoman who engages in a palay trading and rice production business. She buys palay and trades its rice grains for added income.

Joan has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Joan hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato, who is 51 years old from the village of Sartichala. She lives with her pensioner father. Nato earns a living with working as a waitress at the local restaurant and gets a small income. The family lives under poverty as the income is not enough to cover even basic needs of their family. According to above mentioned situation, Nato lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nato to get a loan of 2500 GEL and start a trading business. She will take the leasehold place for general store, which has a great location in the capital and will purchase all needed products. Nato will start working as a sales lady and will do her best to make the business work in a profitable way.

After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. With support of the Start Up program Nato will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle with the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a general store and have her own business activity.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Charity dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour and maize for resale

loans.name: Anastasio's Group

texts.en:
Anastasio and Benito live in San Miguel Buenavista, a small town located in Tlacoapa, Guerrero. They live with their families and like many in their community, they lack electricity in their household. Nowadays, they use candles and wood to light their houses, but these sources are considered inefficient, harmful to their health and expensive. Anastasio and Benito are farmers and from sunrise to sunset they spend all day in the field cultivating corn, beans and pumpkins. With the money they earn, they try to give the best to their families, but sometimes it is not enough to cover the basic needs.

Currently, Anastasio and Benito each spend around 100 mexican pesos to buy candles and wood, which represents a high percentage of their monthly income. After paying the total cost of the solar system they will be able to save money for incidentals, and also they will be able to take care of their families keeping them away from candles and wood.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system for his family

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea ’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chea  makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phan makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old and has four children. Teresita is married and all her four children are still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise pigs.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 48 years old, married with four children, two of whom are in school. Ninfa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ninfa requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds, and pay for the repair of her pig-pen. Ninfa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds, and pay for the repair of her pig-pen

loans.name: Ma. Jobelle

texts.en:
Ma. Jobelle is 30 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.

Ma. Jobelle is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ma. Jobelle is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed & supplies to raise pigs.

loans.name: Harrieti

texts.en:
Harrieti is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sylevano

texts.en:
Sylevano is a married man with 4 children aged 59 years and a resident of Fort Portal –Uganda. He is involved in agriculture and teaches in a government school. He has been in the teaching services for 30 years and in agriculture for 40 years. The reason behind engaging in business was to have income for family development. Being the head of the family, he ensures that his family does not lack a thing, despite the difficulties of unfavorable weather conditions and little plus delayed salary payment from the government. He has an aspiration of being self employed after retirement.

Sylevano will use the requested loan to pay tuition for his child at the University.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his child at the University.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokhim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Nimaro Women's Group

texts.en:
Grace a member of Nimaro Women comprised group is a resident of Kamuswahili,lira. She is a widow with three school going children, having lost her husband to the northern war insurgence. She is a business woman selling foodstuffs.

In a bid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 700,000 with Ugafode micro finance to boost her business. This will help her to buy in bulk and at a cheaper price raising his profits. She will buy stock of household appliances like kitchen ware, groceries and other items for trade to raise her family's income.

She is very grateful for the support provided by Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Thum's Group

texts.en:
Thum’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thum makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as seller by selling grocery to support her family. She has one young child in her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Diosis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Diosis, es una mujer que vive con su familia, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, ella se dedica a atender su tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad y de consumo además, atiende una tortillería y la hace con la ayuda de sus hijos, este oficio ella lo aprendió por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante.
Diosis solicita el crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra pan, bebidas, boquitas, granos básicos, etc., para surtir la tienda y así poder sacar buenas ganancias por la temporada navideña que se avecina, con esto ella busca incrementar su inventario además de atraer más clientes.
El sueño de Diosis es poder darle una estabilidad económica a su grupo familiar además de poder cancelar al día su crédito y poder cubrir otros compromisos que ella ha adquirido.
texts.en:
Diosis is a woman who lives with her family. She has three children who depend on her financially. She works managing her store that offers prime need products and staples. Also, she serves tortillas and her children help her. She learned this trade on her own initiative because of the need to support her children.

Diosis is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of bread, drinks, snacks, basic grains, etc., to stock the store so she can make good profits during the holiday season ahead. With this, she seeks to increase her inventory and also attract more customers.

Diosis dreams of being able to give her family financial stability and of being able to stay up to date with her loan and of being able to cover other commitments she has acquired.

loans.use: to buy bread, drinks, snacks, basic grains, etc., to stock the store so she can make good profits during the holiday season ahead

loans.name: Umodzi Group

texts.en:
Fasanawo is 30 years old and married. She has 5 children and 2 relatives that depend on her. Her husband owns a hardware business.

Fasanawo owns a snacks business. She started this business with the aim of supporting her relatives financially. She would like to use this loan to buy a bag of flour and a Irish potatoes to stock up her business. the profits from the business will help her to pay school fees for her children.

Fasanawo hopes to buy a plot of land where to build a house with the profits from the business. She also hopes to change her business to one selling rice in future.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour and Irish potatoes for her snacks business

loans.name: Gereliosa

texts.en: Gereliosa is an active member of Paglaum MPC since 1999 and access its financial services on her chosen business ventures. She managed her membership well evident to her records of no default payments. Recently, she approache Paglaum MPC to loan an amount to pay for medical bills and purchase of maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical bills and purchase of maintenance medicines

loans.name: Ma. Cherie

texts.en: Ma. Cherie has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Ma. Cherie knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Tamuna

texts.en:
Tamuna is 22 years old, from a small village Kvemo Gomi. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and brother-in-law. The family members are private workers and get small income from orders. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.

Tamuna had decided to start agribusiness and set-up a poultry farm with the saved money of the family. Now she needs financial support to purchase food for chickens and make her business work properly. The local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses.
Tamuna and her family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders, as the family's income will significantly increase and give them a chance to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food for her newly set-up poultry farm .

Khern’s group lives in a rural village in the Kompong Thom province of Cambodia. Khern makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a fisherman to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.en: Cleotilde is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC and an active member since 2010. She has access various products and services including loan products and insurance services. Recently, she asks Paglaum MPC an amount to pay for medical bills and purchase of maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical bills and purchase of maintenance medicines

loans.name: Rosemelita

texts.en: Rosemelita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Rosemilita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Yolanda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a married woman who works hard to support two children. She has a general store and requests 10,400 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours after nightfall.

Renalyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mtendere Group

texts.en:
Blessings is 53 years od and married. Her husband works as a driver.

Blessings sells clothes for a living. She would like to use this loan to buy more clothes in Tanzania to sell. The profits from the business will enable her to buy food for her home. Blesssings started her business to provide for her family.

She hopes to continue taking good care of her family, by providing them with their needs. She also hopes to buy a car in a couple years to come.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saphin`s Group

texts.en:
Saphin’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Saphin grows rice, sells items and works construction to support her family.

Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vilma Santos

texts.es: Vilma es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad, que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas por mayoreo, actividad que lleva realizando desde hace 2 años. Ella habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus 3 hijos una niña de 14 años y dos varones de 18 y 16 años de edad, a los que saca adelante como madre soltera. Vilma desea incrementar sus ventas, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos que no logra cumplir por falta de materia prima. Por lo anterior Vilma solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de piñatas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 45-years-old working woman who makes a living making and selling piñatas in bulk. She has been performing this activity for 2 years. She lives at home, which she owns, together with her 3 children, a 14-years-old girl and two boys aged 18 and 16, whom she is raising as a single mother.

Vilma wishes to increase her sales, since she has many orders which she cannot fulfil due to lack of supplies. Therefore, Vilma is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in supplies to make piñatas.

loans.use: to invest in supplies to make piñatas and fulfil her customer's requirements.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don juan de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el cliente se dedica a vender bolis(helados de sabores) posee más de 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual ha logrado salir adelante, anteriormente solicito un credito para la compra de materia prima, hoy esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de una nueva refrigeradora para poder mantener sus productos congelados y asi poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old. He lives in his own home with his life partner.

He works selling Bolis (flavored ice cream). He has more than 15 years experience in this activity and has successfully moved ahead.

Previously he asked for a loan to buy prime materials. Today he is asking for a new loan to buy a new refrigerator to keep his products frozen and thus be able to continue with his sales as that is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to keep Bolis (flavored ice cream) frozen so he can continue his work

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.
