loans.name: Ricardo Alberto

texts.es: Don Ricardo de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de bonsai y ademas vende plantas ornamentales, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas plantas ornamentales y bonsai para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ricardo is 66 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He makes a living selling bonsai and ornamental plants, which he has been doing for 6 years. With the profits he managed to manage to settle some home costs. He is applying for a loan to buy more ornamental plants and bonsai to continue with his sales and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more ornamental plants and bonsai.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her six children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Joy has requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp as she wants to have a back-up light, in case of emergency.

Mary Joy is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment, and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. She sells rice grains in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Mailyn requested another loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and requested another loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Mailyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lolibeth

texts.en:
Lolibeth is a married woman with two children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transportation business. Lolibeth is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat.

Lolibeth has sustained her business through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Jose Del Rosario

texts.es:
José, es un hombre que se encuentra acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo el cual depende económicamente de él, José se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como lo son maíz, frijoles, maicillo y hortalizas; él aprendió este oficio gracias a sus padres que desde pequeño lo involucraron en las tareas agrícolas.
José solicita el crédito para poderlo invertir en la recolección de granos básicos y en la compra de otro tipo de verduras, esto le permitirá poder generar mayores ingresos con los que podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El sueño es seguir trabajando para lograr una mejor condición de vida él y su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and son, who depend on him financially. José makes a living cultivating basic grains such as corn, beans, sorghum, and vegetables. He learned this skill from his parents, who involved him in agricultural work since childhood.

José is requesting a loan to invest in harvesting basic grains and to buy other types of vegetables, which would allow him to increase his income which he would use to provide a better quality of life for his family. His dream is to keep working to obtain a better life for his family.

loans.use: to invest in harvesting basic grains and purchasing other types of vegetables, which would increase his income.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to new fishing equipment like fishing nets and tackle for her fishing business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to new fishing equipment like fishing nets and tackle.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia, vive con su esposo e hijo, ella y su grupo familiar se dedican a la venta de semilla de marañón y lo hacen en conjunto, ya que es ella quien se encarga de quemar la semilla de marañón posteriormente su esposo y su hijo se encargan de quebrarla para luego poderla comercializar. 
Eusebia solicita el crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de utensilios para el desarrollo de la actividad como: lo son peroles para azar las semillas, huacales, bolsas y semilla de marañón; le será de ayuda para tener más facilidades y comodidades en el desarrollo sus actividades y de esa manera ofrecerá un producto de calidad que le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Eusebia es poder tener una sostenibilidad con el negocio, que le permita dar mejores oportunidades a su grupo familiar y una vida digna.
texts.en:
Eusebia lives with her husband and son. She and her family are dedicated to selling cashew nuts and they do it together. She is in charge of roasting the cashews and afterwards her husband and son are in charge of cracking them so they can be sold later.

Eusebia is asking for a loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of tools for doing her work such as: pots to roast the nuts, crates, bags, and cashews. It will help to have more facilities and amenities in the development of their activities so they will be able to offer a quality product to help them have higher income.

Eusebia’s dream is to be able to have a sustainable business that allows her to give her family better opportunities and a decent life.

loans.use: to buy tools for doing her work such as: pots to roast the nuts, crates, bags, and cashews

loans.name: Nety

texts.en:
Nety is 37 years old, married with two school age children from Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a governement employee whose pushing her abilities to be of great used to the public.

She enrolled in a Masters Degree course and she's on the final semester where she needs to make a Masters thesis. She approached Paglaum MPC where she is an active member to finance her school requirements through its loan program. The amount shall be used to pay for Masters Degree thesis expenses.

loans.use: to pay for Masters thesis expenses

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charity works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. Charity is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like new fishing nets. She will also pay for gasoline and boat repairs for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Charity has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like new fishing nets, and to pay for gasoline and boat repairs.

loans.name: Siniyèsigui  (0057) Group

texts.fr: Le profil concerne Djènèba la femme qui est devant le sac remplit d’arachide et la main dessus ; commerçante malienne d'arachide âgé de 33 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants, ses enfant sont âgées de 2 à 17 ans dont deux filles  scolarisé.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de sa localité chaque semaine,  ensuite elle revend ses arachides décortiqués dans les marchés la plus proche; elle gagne  10000FCFA de bénéfice par mois ; elle s’en sort bien, mais  pour élargir son activité commerciale, elle  demande un service financier (prêt) auprès du RMCR dans le but de pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce, et se faire plus de profits en vue de survenu aux besoins familiales .elle travaille avec le RMCR il y a 5 ans  et sa crédibilité n’a pas fait défaut. Son rêve est d’avoir dans l’avenir  un bon magasin pour  stocker plus de produits.
texts.en:
The featured borrower is Djènèba, standing in the front with her hand on a bag full of groundnuts in the group photo. She is a 33-year-old reseller of groundnuts from Mali, married with 5 children ages 2 to 17; she has two daughters in school. She buys her stock at the local market each week, then sells the shelled groundnuts at nearby markets; she earns a profit of 10,000FCFA per month.

While Djènèba is doing well, she wants to expand her activity. To that end, she is seeking a loan with RMCR to bolster her working capital and increase her profits. This will help her to support her family.

She joined RMCR five years ago and her credibility has not failed. Her goal is to have a shop to store more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Liberathe is a 43-year-old married mother of six children between the ages of 8 and 23. She has owned and operated a goat-selling business, selling goats to the market where she stays.

She is a leader of this group "abishyizehamwe" in her local language, which in English means "being together." She has a book in her hands.

This enterprise requires her to work from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day, and still she manages her household.

Liberathe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more goats to sell.

She intends to use the profits from her business to save for the next years or, in the future, to pay school fees for her children, to buy new clothes for the family, and to be in a better life than before, even insurance for her children and herself. * The extra person in this photo, the man standing near the bike, is the hudband of one of the borrowers

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more goats to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 49 years old, widow with two adult age children. She is a governement employee and had supported her family through her salary. She had bought a parcel of land through the financial support of Paglaum MPC.She wants to cultivate the area for her farming activities and would help her raise income for the family. Recently, she availed a loan to pay for land title processing.

loans.use: to pay for land title processing

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marilou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Erose

texts.en:
Erose works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Erose requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Erose is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a widowed woman. She is 56 years old and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Crispina has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like cloth, zippers, and thread, and to maintain her sewing machine.

Crispina has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth, zippers, and thread, and to maintain her sewing machine.

loans.name: Liony

texts.en:
Liony works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Liony requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours after nightfall.

Liony is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 54 года, замужем, есть 5 детей, двое младших детей живут с Айгул. У нее - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. У Айгул есть 2 коровы, 97 овец, 2 лошади. На 3,18 Га земли выращивает люцерну и ячмень для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет - 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 жеребят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigul is 54 years old, married, and has five children. The two youngest children live with Aigul. She has a secondary vocational education. She farms as the main source of income for her family. Aigul has two cows, 97 sheep, and two horses. She grows alfalfa and barley for sale and for her use on her own farm on 3.18 hectares of land. Her monthly profit is 14,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Aigul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two foals in order to increase the size of her herd. Aigul plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two foals in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Young's Group

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly a responsible mother requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is 55 years old, widow, with five adult age children. She retails used shoes as her source of income that helped her raised her children. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase more inventories of shoes for reselling.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of shoes for reselling.

loans.name: Jose Hermites

texts.en: Jose Hermites believes education is a key to success in life. He wants his children to earn a degree and become successful citizens. Jose Hermites wants to help his family and his children to finish their education. With the loan of PHP 15,000, he will be able to pay for tuition and graduation costs.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and graduation costs.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with ten children. Two of whom are in school.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane and tricycle passenger businesses.

Caridad dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.
